Name: Admin Downloads - Product entitlement matrix
Notes:
Email address:
neeshil@lup.events

Title of the task:
Admin Downloads - Product entitlement matrix

Due Date:
Apr 18, 2025

Priority:
Normal

Description:
For complicated events we want the ability for onsite team to see all products, their entitlements and which ticketing surveys are they allocated to

    1. Product survey matrix
    2. Product entitlement report

Neeshil has a sample query



-- Survey product matrix
DECLARE @columns NVARCHAR(MAX), @sql NVARCHAR(MAX);

-- Step 1: Get the list of distinct TicketProductCodes and build the column names
SELECT @columns = STUFF((
    SELECT DISTINCT ', ' + QUOTENAME(ticketproductcode)
    FROM ticketproducts
    WHERE ticketproductcode IS NOT NULL AND eventID = 2420
    FOR XML PATH(''), TYPE
).value('.', 'NVARCHAR(MAX)'), 1, 2, '');

-- Step 2: Build the dynamic SQL query
SET @sql = N'
SELECT surveyID,
       surveytitle,
       stand, ' + @columns + N'
FROM
(
    SELECT survey.surveyID,
           survey.surveytitle,
           survey.stand,
           ticketproductcode
    FROM Survey
    LEFT OUTER JOIN SurveyTicketProducts
        ON survey.surveyID = surveyticketproducts.SurveyID
        AND surveyticketproducts.Status = ''Active''
    LEFT OUTER JOIN ticketproducts
        ON surveyticketproducts.TicketProductID = ticketproducts.ticketproductID
    WHERE survey.eventID = 2420
    AND surveystatus = ''Active''
    AND surveydevicemode = 5
) AS source_data
PIVOT
(
    COUNT(ticketproductcode) FOR ticketproductcode IN (' + @columns + N')
) AS pivot_table
ORDER BY surveytitle;';

-- Step 3: Execute the dynamic SQL
EXEC sp_executesql @sql;

Name: IMARC RT Question Option APICodes updtes
Tags: Dev Team Request,ACCEPTED (Dev Team Request),Late Request,Critical
Notes:
Email address:
neeshil@lup.events

Title of the task:
IMARC RT Question Option APICodes updtes

Due Date:
Apr 17, 2025

Priority:
Urgent - 24 hours turnaround

Event Code:
2510 IMARC 2511 RT

Description:
For IMARC and RT, we use QuestionAPICodes and OptionAPICodes for the API integrator to read when using integrate API.

Organiser has given updated mappings on this sheet using the two tabs beginning with "DEV -" One for questionOptions and one for Questions.

    Questions: Update the SvcQuestionTitle field and QuestionAPICode
    QuestionOptions: Update the QuestionOptionsAPICode and the OptionCode field

    Please backup all relevant data before updating
    Update the fields
    Check make sure the update does match what was requested. (eg maybe it got truncated when we pushed it in to SQL)
    Export all data again on new tab same as 'import file as at xxxxx'

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/14vbLdXuj9Og4_p4SXJgqgkpAcH8nX4Gwkis1Kq2wXH8/edit?gid=653031507#gid=653031507


Code to export data

-- Information for API integrator

-- Product Questions Mappings
-- Includes conditional questionsID

DECLARE @listOfIDs TABLE (id INT);
INSERT INTO @listOfIDs (id) VALUES (2551), (2573);


-- QuestionOptions Mappings
SELECT
    e.EventID,
    e.EventCode,
    e.EventOrganiserCode,
    qd.Sequence as Do_Not_Edit_DisplaySortOrder,
       qd.ConditionalOptionID  as Do_Not_Edit_Show_When_This_OptionID_Selected,

    -- NEW: Descriptive conditional logic
    CASE
        WHEN qd.ConditionalOptionID IS NOT NULL THEN
            ISNULL(
                ParentOption.OptionValue + ' (' +
                REPLACE(REPLACE(ParentQuestion.Question, CHAR(13), ''), CHAR(10), '') + ')',
               ''-- 'OptionID: ' + CAST(qd.ConditionalOptionID AS VARCHAR)
            )
        ELSE NULL
    END  as Do_Not_Edit_calcShow_When_This_Question,

    qd.QuestionDetailsID as Do_Not_Edit_QuestionDetailsID,
    REPLACE(REPLACE(qd.Question, CHAR(13), ''), CHAR(10), '') AS Do_Not_Edit_QuestionContent,
     qd.QuestionApiCode ,
  -- qd.SvcQuestionTitle,
 --   qd.QuestionStatus,

CASE
    WHEN qd.QuestionStatus IS NULL THEN NULL
    WHEN qd.QuestionStatus = 'Active' THEN 'FALSE'
    ELSE 'TRUE'
END  as Do_Not_Edit_QuestionIsArchived,

    qd.QuestionCSVStatus AS [Do_Not_Edit_ExportQuestionToCSV?],



    qo.OptionID    as Do_Not_Edit_OptionID ,
    qo.OptionValue  as Do_Not_Edit_OptionContent,
    qo.QuestionOptionApiCode as OptionAPICode,
 --   qo.OptionCode,
CASE
    WHEN qo.OptionStatus IS NULL THEN NULL
    WHEN qo.OptionStatus = 'Active' THEN 'FALSE'
    ELSE 'TRUE'
END AS    Do_Not_Edit_OptionIsArchived,
        qo.OptionCSVStatus AS [ExportOptionToCSV?]



FROM
    Event e
    INNER JOIN Survey s ON e.EventID = s.EventID
    INNER JOIN QuestionDetails qd ON s.SurveyID = qd.SurveyID
    LEFT JOIN QuestionOptions qo ON qd.QuestionDetailsID = qo.QuestionDetailsID

    -- Join back to parent option and its question
    LEFT JOIN QuestionOptions ParentOption ON qd.ConditionalOptionID = ParentOption.OptionID
    LEFT JOIN QuestionDetails ParentQuestion ON ParentOption.QuestionDetailsID = ParentQuestion.QuestionDetailsID

WHERE
    qd.QuestionStatus = 'Active'
    AND e.EventID IN (SELECT id FROM @listOfIDs)
    AND s.SurveyDeviceMode = 1
    AND s.SurveyStatus = 'Active'
    AND qd.QuestionTypeID NOT IN (25, 26, 27, 28)
    AND (qo.OptionCSVStatus = 1 OR qo.OptionCSVStatus IS NULL)
    -- AND qo.OptionStatus != 'Deleted'

ORDER BY
    e.EventDateStart,
    e.EventID,
    qd.Sequence,
    qd.QuestionDetailsID,
    qo.OptionOrder,
    qd.Question;

Name: remove Duplicate LookupContactTitles
Notes:
Email address:
neeshil@lup.events

Title of the task:
Duplicate LookupContactTitles

Due Date:
Apr 15, 2025

Priority:
Urgent - 24 hours turnaround

Description:
On Decor design we have ability for exhibitors to fill in their contact details so it appears on oragniser's website. (We use ExhibitorForms for this) https://admin.lup.com.au/EventExhibitor/Index/ed736c27-6ca3-46a0-b4ac-231f096d1987?sId=53353

It appears that when exhibitors add their website or other contact method, our system is inserting in to the LookupContactTitles table.

This also means that then we have multiple options for 'Website' or 'Phone' etc.


https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1209972037327925



This task is to Clean up the LookupContactTitles table. We should run it every few weeks please

This is how I used to do it. Just update Exhibitor Contact records to point to the main "Website" lookup record and then mark the duplicate 'Website' lookup to be inactive


-- This page update and remove duplicate ContactTitles in Lookup Table


-- Show which Titles are duplicated in the Lookup Table

SELECT     ContactTitle, COUNT(ContactTitleId) AS count
FROM         LookupContactTitles where ContactTitleStatus='Active'
GROUP BY ContactTitle

-- See which ID's are being used in the EventExbhibitorContactDetails table
select DISTINCT ContactTitleID from EventExhibitorContactDetails order by ContactTitleId

select * from lookupcontacttitles where contacttitlestatus='Active'

-- select * from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Website' and ContactTitleId <> 7

select * from EventExhibitorContactDetails where ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Website' and ContactTitleId <> 7)
select * from EventExhibitorContactDetails where ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Email' and ContactTitleId <> 1)

-- Update Websites
 UPDATE EventExhibitorContactDetails SET ContactTitleId = 7 Where  ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Website' and ContactTitleId <> 7)
 UPDATE LookupContactTitles SET ContactTitleStatus='Inactive' where  ContactTitle='Website' and ContactTitleId <> 7

-- Update Email
 UPDATE EventExhibitorContactDetails SET ContactTitleId = 1 Where  ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Email' and ContactTitleId <> 1)
 UPDATE LookupContactTitles SET ContactTitleStatus='Inactive' where  ContactTitle='Email' and ContactTitleId <> 1

 -- Update Facebook
 UPDATE EventExhibitorContactDetails SET ContactTitleId = 3 Where  ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Facebook' and ContactTitleId <> 3)
 UPDATE LookupContactTitles SET ContactTitleStatus='Inactive' where  ContactTitle='Facebook' and ContactTitleId <> 3
 
 -- Update Instagram
 UPDATE EventExhibitorContactDetails SET ContactTitleId = 8 Where  ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Instagram' and ContactTitleId <> 8)
 UPDATE LookupContactTitles SET ContactTitleStatus='Inactive' where  ContactTitle='Instagram' and ContactTitleId <> 8
  
  -- Update LinkedIn
 UPDATE EventExhibitorContactDetails SET ContactTitleId = 5 Where  ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='LinkedIn' and ContactTitleId <> 5)
 UPDATE LookupContactTitles SET ContactTitleStatus='Inactive' where  ContactTitle='LinkedIn' and ContactTitleId <> 5

   -- Update Phone Number
 UPDATE EventExhibitorContactDetails SET ContactTitleId = 2 Where  ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Phone Number' and ContactTitleId <> 2)
 UPDATE LookupContactTitles SET ContactTitleStatus='Inactive' where  ContactTitle='Phone Number' and ContactTitleId <> 2

    -- Twitter
 UPDATE EventExhibitorContactDetails SET ContactTitleId = 4 Where  ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Twitter' and ContactTitleId <> 4)
 UPDATE LookupContactTitles SET ContactTitleStatus='Inactive' where  ContactTitle='Twitter' and ContactTitleId <> 4

     -- Youtube
 UPDATE EventExhibitorContactDetails SET ContactTitleId = 9 Where  ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Youtube' and ContactTitleId <> 9)
 UPDATE LookupContactTitles SET ContactTitleStatus='Inactive' where  ContactTitle='Youtube' and ContactTitleId <> 9

      -- Pinterest
 UPDATE EventExhibitorContactDetails SET ContactTitleId = 6 Where  ContactTitleId in (select contactTitleID from lookupcontactTitles where ContactTitle='Pinterest' and ContactTitleId <> 6)
 UPDATE LookupContactTitles SET ContactTitleStatus='Inactive' where  ContactTitle='Pinterest' and ContactTitleId <> 6

Name: SXSW insert UpgradePacks mappings
Tags: Dev Team Request,ACCEPTED (Dev Team Request),Late Request
Notes:
ON HOLD UNTIL ADVISED BY https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1207189952213150


For SXSW we are using the UpgradePacks table to do some mappings of which packs can be upgraded to which other packs

This https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1EFfzDLlXtnGtN-J7l382ful040O-DamR2K0hAQxUkMI/edit?gid=0#gid=0  on the tab Pack UpgradePacks relationship has the OriginalPackID and the "New UpgradePackID" column (in BLUE COLUMNS ONLY)

To insert in to the UpgradePacks table




-- PackUpgrade mappings for checking by Production team
SELECT
    p.TicketPackCategory,
    p.TicketPackID AS OriginalPackID,
    p.TicketPackName AS OriginalPackName,
    p.TicketPackPrice AS OriginalPackPrice,
    p.TicketPackStatus AS OriginalPackStatus,
    u.UpgradePackID,
    pp.TicketPackName AS UpgradePackName,
    pp.TicketPackPrice AS UpgradePackPrice,
    pp.TicketPackStatus AS UpgradePackStatus,
    CASE
        WHEN LOWER(p.TicketPackName) LIKE '%group%'
          OR LOWER(p.TicketPackName) LIKE '%platinum%'
          OR LOWER(p.TicketPackName) LIKE '%satur%'
        THEN 'Exclude'
        ELSE ''
    END AS Exclude
FROM
    TicketPacks p
LEFT JOIN
    PackUpgrades u ON u.OriginalPackID = p.TicketPackID
LEFT JOIN
    TicketPacks pp ON pp.TicketPackID = u.UpgradePackID AND pp.EventID = 2540
WHERE
    p.EventID = 2540
    AND p.TicketPackLevel = 1
ORDER BY
    p.TicketPackCategory,
    p.TicketPackName,
    p.TicketPackID,
    pp.TicketPackName

Name: Copy IMARC APICodes to RT
Notes:
Email address:
neeshil@lup.events

Title of the task:
Copy IMARC APICodes to RT

Due Date:
Apr 9, 2025

Priority:
Urgent - 24 hour turnaround

Event Code:
2512 Resourcing Tomorrow

Description:
For Resourcing tomorrow we want to bulk update QuestionAPICode and OptionAPICodes based off the corresponding (recently updated) values in IMARC

IMARC is the Source and RT is the destination

RT: https://admin.lup.com.au/Event/EventDetail/2573
IMARC: https://admin.lup.com.au/Event/EventDetail/2551


1. if the RT.Question = IMARC.Question and their APICode's don't match then update the QuestionAPICode and the SvcQuestionTitle

2. If the RT.Question = IMARc.Question and RT.QuestionOptionValue = Imarc.QuestionOptionValue  and the OptionAPICodes don't match then Update Rt.QuestionOptionAPICode = IMARC.QuestionOptionAPICode (and also update OptionCode)

Please check first if any ambiguities (ie two questions match) that will cause issues

Ideally give me a before/after value list too


Neeshil used his code and combined with AI generated queries. Double check these may or may not be accurate

 


SELECT
    q1.question AS question_53613,
    q2.question AS question_54804,

    q1.questiondetailsID AS questiondetailsID_53613,
    q1.questionapicode AS questionapicode_53613,

    q2.questiondetailsID AS questiondetailsID_54804,
    q2.questionapicode AS questionapicode_54804
FROM
    questiondetails q1
JOIN
    questiondetails q2 ON q1.question = q2.question
WHERE
    q1.surveyID = 53613
    AND q2.surveyID = 54804
    AND (
        q1.questionapicode <> q2.questionapicode
        OR (q1.questionapicode IS NULL AND q2.questionapicode IS NOT NULL)
        OR (q1.questionapicode IS NOT NULL AND q2.questionapicode IS NULL)
    );








SELECT
    q1.question AS question_53613,
    q2.question AS question_54804,

    q1.questiondetailsID AS questiondetailsID_53613,
    q1.questionapicode AS questionapicode_53613,
    qo1.optionvalue AS optionvalue_53613,
    qo1.questionoptionapicode AS optionapicode_53613,

    q2.questiondetailsID AS questiondetailsID_54804,
    q2.questionapicode AS questionapicode_54804,
    qo2.optionvalue AS optionvalue_54804,
    qo2.questionoptionapicode AS optionapicode_54804
FROM
    questiondetails q1
JOIN
    questiondetails q2 ON q1.question = q2.question
JOIN
    questionoptions qo1 ON qo1.questiondetailsID = q1.questiondetailsID
JOIN
    questionoptions qo2 ON qo2.questiondetailsID = q2.questiondetailsID
    AND qo1.optionvalue = qo2.optionvalue
WHERE
    q1.surveyID = 53613
    AND q2.surveyID = 54804
    AND (
        qo1.questionoptionapicode <> qo2.questionoptionapicode
        OR (qo1.questionoptionapicode IS NULL AND qo2.questionoptionapicode IS NOT NULL)
        OR (qo1.questionoptionapicode IS NOT NULL AND qo2.questionoptionapicode IS NULL)
    );

Name: IMPORTANT: Add Onsite Sales into Console Sales Reports
Notes:
Currently for events that sell tickets onsite with Lup onsite tickets (printed QR CODES):
     the online sales reports only show the online numbers, and 
    onsite quantities and $ have to be seen in the Square reports.  
    So the organiser needs to see two reports. 
    (But also some of the onsite tickets are in the online report if they get registered.). This is not ideal

So we want a systematic way, at end of each day, to upload the data in to expodb so it appears on online sales reports and also univeral download
 
    Square ITEM SALES report will have the ticket barcode attached to each line
    Square tickets are also scanned on a dedicated lead scanner "Square sales"
    If a user registers on an iPad they are getting their ticket order created automatically ($0 , default pack)
    So knowing this we want to tidy it up, so that at end of each day, the 'Square onsite packs/products' match the square sales dashboard'

    1: Square sales using ITEM export from Square:
        UPDATE EXISTING: If the barcode Exists in tickets table already and has a PackID = 58023 (Onsite Registered)
            update: pack/product, price, transaction, order amount, so that it matches the square report
        or CREATE NEW: If it doesn't exist, then add to expodb as a ticket/ticketorder etc with pack/product, price, transaction + order value set so it matches the square report
        IF THERE IS NO BARCODE ??? on the item in Square Export - add it with a random new barcode that starts with 3xxxxxx
    2: Square sales lead  scanner
        https://admin.lup.com.au/Survey/EditSurvey/54409
        If a barcode is scanned on this (7 digits only) and does Not exist in tickets table, add it as generic  pack/product (eg Square - Other  PackID 59811) with $0 price allocated. (Create the $0 transaction too)
    3: For any other Onsite tickets scanned but not already in tickets table from the 1 and 2 above
        SCANNED means: Select distinct answer.barcode from Answer where surveyID in (Select surveyID from survey where eventID=2526) and answer.deviceID not in (622,104)
            And Barcode not exists in Tickets.shortcode where eventID=2526 and TicketStatus='Active'
        Add as generic pack/product ONSITE UNREGISTERED (PackID 59838) $0 
        Filter it for scans that are 7 digits only and all numeric. Ignore other scans


https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rVPvRY6prKAnm-wT7cMVcy7bmYlSjq3ir7dptIwrrCs/edit?gid=510253785#gid=510253785

Name: AusFit DailyCheck Savetime vs ImportTime
Notes:
We want to make sure all devices have the correct time.

Run this code daily to check and we might have to adjust savetime possibly



-- How many minutes behind or ahead is a device
SELECT
    s.EventID,
    a.DeviceID,
    a.SurveyID,
    s.SurveyTitle,
    ABS(DATEDIFF(MINUTE, a.SaveTime, a.ImportTime)) AS MinutesOffset,
    COUNT(a.AnswerID) AS CountOfAnswerID
FROM
    Answer a
JOIN
    Survey s ON a.SurveyID = s.SurveyID
WHERE
    s.EventID = 2526
--a.savetime >='2025-03-01'
    AND a.DeviceID NOT IN (622, 104)
    AND ABS(DATEDIFF(MINUTE, a.SaveTime, a.ImportTime)) > 10
GROUP BY
    s.EventID,
    a.DeviceID,
    a.SurveyID,
    s.SurveyTitle,
    ABS(DATEDIFF(MINUTE, a.SaveTime, a.ImportTime))
ORDER BY
    s.eventID, a.surveyID, a.deviceID, MinutesOffset DESC,
    CountOfAnswerID DESC;

Name: Local gtw and TLS termination

Name: Implement Region API on the UI
Vendor Approved Sessions RX Global
Notes:
Dates:
    Final session list from RX to Lup: 15 November 
    Final testing: 15 November
    Visitors register for sessions: 1st December
    Exhibitors log in and view applicants: 1st December
    Exhibitor have ability to approve: 10 January

Overview
    Currently those who register in RX Mercury can not purchase add-ons
    Currently RX Mercury needs a way, at certain shows, for visitors to request/apply to attend ‘vendor approved sessions’

Solution:
    Provides a way for registrants in RX Mercury to seamlessly select sessions to attend, using Lüp’s system
    It allows for exhibitors to log in and approve or reject registrants in to their sessions 
    This same system will also allow for paid or free add-ons (that do not require approval) to be sold at other RX Mercury events, with minimal additional work

https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1IMMyKKmCg-xgO5gtE4kn5MAE66oV_EAbFX4gVJ4imEU/edit#slide=id.g276c8383cf6_1_11

    Mercury registrant clicks a link and takes to addons page in ticketing with URL and QRCODE pre-populated https://tickets.lup.com.au/AddOn/Get/2421?email=xxxxxx&qr=11111
        If email and QR is provided in URL it should auto-submit this page
    API integration to receive data from RX:
        Update every 5 mins automatically and/or
        When a registrant uses the AddOn/get link it should fetch directly from RX on demand
    Addon selection
        Existing add-ons should be fine
        Need the ability to come back in later and de-select an add-on (no refunds needed at this time)
    Add-ons with 'verification'  NEW status 
        Some add-ons we may set with the product field of 'requires approval'
        This means the status on the addon will be 'verification'  NEW (or similar)
        So that means it's not a confirmed addon, but awaiting approval or rejection by the vendor (exhibitor)
    Confirmation Emails:
        Visitor confirmation email after add-on 'purchase'
            It should show summary of addons and their status. eg "Pending" approval or "Approved" "waitlisted",  rejected. (Need to confirm with organiser if we want visitor to see that they are waitlisted or not)
            Confirmation email sent after exhibitor updates the status of an addon (application)
    Vendor (Exhibitor) link to products
        Client (ie vendors/exhibitors) will need to be linked to an add-on product so that when they log in they can see the visitors requesting approval and actually approve them
    Vendor console amendments
        New section "Sessions" (or does it use existing event list - whatever is quickest)
        Vendor event list
        Vendor event details
            Showing sessions https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1IMMyKKmCg-xgO5gtE4kn5MAE66oV_EAbFX4gVJ4imEU/edit#slide=id.g2e80a8b896b_0_9 slide
            https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1IMMyKKmCg-xgO5gtE4kn5MAE66oV_EAbFX4gVJ4imEU/edit#slide=id.g2e80a8b896b_1_7 ("Exhibitors -approve applicants") that shows applicants and filters/summary
                Ability to approve/reject/waitlist
                Filter
    Organiser - View sessions
        Shows a https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1IMMyKKmCg-xgO5gtE4kn5MAE66oV_EAbFX4gVJ4imEU/edit#slide=id.g2e80a8b896b_1_14 (Organiser - View sessions slide) for all vendors (Exhibitors) and a summary of utilisation/approvals
        https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1IMMyKKmCg-xgO5gtE4kn5MAE66oV_EAbFX4gVJ4imEU/edit#slide=id.g2e80a8b896b_2_21 (Organiser - approve applicants) where organiser can view and approve applicants on a specific session.
    Sales reports:
        Needs to support verification status of addons
    Ticket emails:
        Email and PDF should support the 'verification' status. ie they should not show on the ticket pdf.
    Organiser needs to be able to manually cancel a persons whole ticket as well (And cancelled ticket / addons should be removed from all areas)


API Details
 
The api works in such a way that it is paginated using token-based pagination. This means for the first call you will not supply token value, if there are more results then returned in the first call, our api will provide a token in the response which can then be supplied in the next call.  Then you keep calling until the response no longer returns a token.
The only required parameter is the eventEditionGbsCode. But there is an optional modifiedDate, if no modifiedDate is supplied all badges for the event edition will be returned.
If a modifiedDate is supplied then only badges modified since that date will be returned.
 
This allows for them to retrieve incremental updates after an initial data pull.
 
 
POST https://{host}/graphql
 
{
  badges(
    eventEditionGbsCode: "EVE--24" 
    modifiedDate: "2024/01/01"
    token: ""
  ){
{
  "results": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "productCode": "string",
      "contact": {
        "firstName": "string",
        "lastName": "string",
        "email": "string",
        "jobTitle": "string",
        "mobilePhone": "string"
      },
      "organisation": {
        "displayName": "string",
      },
      "status": "Active",
    }
  ],
  "token": "string"
}
  }
}

Check in to location (list of barcodes)
Notes:
As Lup Staff
I want an easy way to check a device in to a location
Using a list of barcodes

We need a button / link "Check in" this takes to a new screen

Device Check In
Check in your devices to a location:

    Date: Label that shows todays date
    Time: Label that shows current time
    Region: Dropdown, alphabetical order
    Location: Dropdown, alphabetical order
    Barcodes: Multiline text box to add barcodes
    SAVE button

Hitting the save button should:
    Update the Region and Location fields for any device that matches the barcodes list
    Log to the Asset audit the User, Date, Time, Region, Location, Barcode, DeviceID

The Barcodes should be compared against any of the Asset ID's (eg QR Code, RFID etc as well as serial number.  Some AssetID types we should not check against. Should we have a boolean against the lookup table. eg NinjaRMM is just an integerID that starts at 1. We should not match against that one when scanning.

If more than one asset matches a barcode then do NOT update.

On success: show a message.
    152 devices updated
    5 devices not found in system
        List barcodes not found
    3 devices not updated due to barcode matching more than one device: 
        List barcodes not updated

Name: Asset: Locations API
Notes:
List, create, update API

Locations table:
    Id guid
    LocationName string required
    Region string optional (values: AU/NZ/SG/USA/UK) 
    Protected bool default to false

Name: Asset: Asset Service API
Notes:
The Asset Management System (AMS) is designed to manage and track various assets within an organization. The system will support listing, searching, viewing details, creating, editing, and bulk importing of assets. Additionally, it will manage mobile services associated with these assets.

API function: List, GetById, Search, Create, Edit, Bulk Import

Assets table:
    Id PK GUID
    BatchId int null - set the value when user using Save & Duplicate button
    SerialNumber string
    Brand string
    Model string
    ModelYear string
    TagId Guid → lookup to Tags table  N to N relation to Tag tables (will implement this in the next iteration)
    Type: Required string (for UI dropdown list:: 
        Access point
        Asset tracker
        Badge printer
        Card printer
        Cash drawer
        Computer
        Crate
        Display
        Handheld
        Paper printer
        Pelican case
        Power bank
        Receipt printer
        Tablet
        USB charger

    Region string enum: AU, NZ
    Status: Required string: Active, Inactive, Lost, Deleted
    Location string, 
    AssetId List of Barcode → lookup to AssetIds table → save to AssetBarcodes table with cols: Id guid, Barcode string, Type string
    Description string
    Touched ?
    OS, ?
    ICCID, (this is already exists in MobileService/SIM table)
    IMEI string ?
    MAC string ?
    MDM Connected At string ? 
    MDM Enrolled At string ?
    Name string ?
    Buy At, ?
    Buy Price ?, 
    Buy From, ?
    Sell Price, ?
    Model EOL FY, ?

Please adjust the swagger doco too

Name: DEV - Set-up Multistore
Notes:
https://admin.lup.com.au/Event/EventDetail/2527

For this Admin set-up we will require a multi-store set-up to contain 2 events:
Decor + Design & Green Design
Australian International Furniture Fair

We will need to consider the following for the set-up
    Separate branded page graphics
    Different Event Overviews

Event ID: 2527
Event Name: Decor + Design & Green Design 2025
URL Slug to use for both stores: decor-design-green-design-2025


Event Overview:
Decor + Design & Green Design
Australian International Furniture Fair


Decor + Design is a 3-day, trade-only show that will take place on Wednesday 16th July - Friday 18th July 2025 at the Melbourne Exhibition Centre.

The show is THE annual destination for interior designers, decorators, architects, retailers and more to connect and be inspired by the latest in furniture, home décor, textiles and art.

Look to the stars. Decor + Design 2025 will be tapping into all the creativity in the cosmos of design, with the theme of Elements. Visitors can see a unique mix of heritage and emerging brands, plus the latest innovations.

Co-located alongside Decor + Design is the Green Design Show, returning for its 2nd year, showcasing excellence in sustainable design.
The Australian International Furniture Fair (AIFF) is a 3-day, trade-only show that will take place on Wednesday 17th July - Friday 19th July 2024 at the Melbourne Exhibition Centre.

This is Australia's premier furniture buying and networking event, and the annual destination for retail chains, online retailers, independent retailers and commercial buyers, to connect and be inspired by the latest in furniture innovations.

AIFF is co-located with Decor + Design and the Green Design Show bringing together all facets of the furniture and design industries, under one roof.
Event website
https://decordesignshow.com.au/

Name: Importer must have sane error messages
Importer - New API
Notes:
I've been giving some thought to the structure of the new importer front end, and I wanted to run an idea by you. 

What do you think of this pattern:

1. User initiates a new import and selects a blueprint (v2).
2. User provides a file, which we upload to S3.
3. API returns a pre-signed URL, batchId, and a JSON schema (compatible with libraries like Ajv) with _comment to say if this prop is a product or answer detail to help structure the responses.
4. We use papaparse streaming to process each row:
- Validate with Ajv.
- If valid, transform the dynamic object to a typed payload and call an upsert endpoint and dispatch a message.
- If invalid, call a log endpoint with the error and row reference.
5. Dispatch all messages, perform necessary actions, and listen for responses to track batch outcomes.
6. Provide endpoint to say result of batch, e.g. pre-signed URL to download the original file, summary of 200 rows processed, 150 imported and the 50 errored and line numbers, (if they want to be able to download a file with errors col on the right lines then Denzel can just pull and update the file in the browser) 

Let me know your thoughts on this approach.

Thanks,
Chris

Example schema

const schema = { "required": ["name", "age"], "properties": { "name": { "type": "string", "errorMessage": "Name is required and should be a string." }, "age": { "type": "number", "errorMessage": "Age is required and should be a number." }, "email": { "type": "string", "format": "email", "errorMessage": "Email should be a valid email address." }, "phone": { "type": "string", "pattern": "^[0-9]{10}$", "errorMessage": "Phone should be a 10 digit number." }, "address": { "type": "string", "errorMessage": "Address should be a string." } }, "oneOf": [ { "required": ["email"], "errorMessage": "Either email or phone must be provided." }, { "required": ["phone"], "errorMessage": "Either email or phone must be provided." } ], "additionalProperties": false, "errorMessage": { "required": { "name": "Name is required.", "age": "Age is required." }, "oneOf": "Either email or phone must be provided, but not both." } };
Blocking (Dependencies): Importer - Ui for new API

Name: AWS Lambda end of support for .NET 6
Notes:
[Action Required] AWS Lambda end of support for .NET 6 [AWS Account: 766365401972] [AP-SOUTHEAST-2]

Hello,

We are contacting you as we have identified that your AWS Account currently has one or more AWS Lambda functions using the .NET 6 runtime.

We are ending support for .NET 6 in Lambda on December 20, 2024. This follows .NET 6 End-Of-Life (EOL) which will be on November 12, 2024 [1].

As described in the Lambda runtime support policy [2], end of support for language runtimes in Lambda happens in several stages. Starting on December 20, 2024, Lambda will no longer apply security patches and other updates to the .NET 6 runtime used by Lambda functions, and functions using .NET 6 will no longer be eligible for technical support. Additionally, the .NET 6 runtime will no longer be available in the Console, although you can still create and update functions using the .NET 6 runtime through AWS CloudFormation, AWS CLI, AWS SAM, or other tools. Starting February 28, 2025, you will no longer be able to create new Lambda functions using the .NET 6 runtime. Starting March 31, 2025, you will no longer be able to update existing functions using the .NET 6 runtime.

We recommend that you upgrade your existing .NET 6 functions to the latest available .NET runtime in Lambda before December 20, 2024.

End of support does not impact function execution. Your functions will continue to run. However, they will be running on an unsupported runtime which is no longer maintained or patched by the AWS Lambda team.

This notification is generated for functions using the .NET 6 runtime for the $LATEST function version. The following command shows how to use the AWS CLI [3] to list all functions in a specific region using .NET 6, including published function versions. To find all such functions in your account, repeat this command for each region:

aws lambda list-functions --region AP-SOUTHEAST-2 --output text --query "Functions[?Runtime=='dotnet6'].FunctionArn"

A list of your affected Lambda functions is available in the 'Affected resources' tab of your AWS Health Dashboard.

From 180 days before the deprecation date, you can also use Trusted Advisor to identify all functions using the .NET 6 runtime, including published function versions [4].

If you have any concerns or require further assistance, please contact AWS Support [5].

[1] https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/platform/support/policy/dotnet-core

Automated checks for TicketOrder transaction integrity
Notes:
Currently on many events, the ticket sales reports from ExpoDB does not match the reality of the orders and transactions.

This can be due to:
    Manual changes to orders. eg partial refunds, refunds, and tickets kept active
    Test transactions being made to ACTIVE
    Transactions going through but not being recorded in our system
    or other inconsistencies

Having the wrong data in ExpoDB means our data is wrong in reporting and in new console, and transformation data set.

We want to perform checks on each TicketOrder, as well as the event as a whole.

As a second step, we want to download the Stripe transactions and compare them with the transactions we have in the DB. (eg today I did that with IODS and realised that one person was charged twice, even though ExpoDB had it marked as 1 transactions PENDING and 1 SUCCESS)

On each TicketOrder:
    does the TicketOrderTotalAmount match the Sum of TicketOrderTransactions
    does the sum of TicketOrderPacks match the TotalTicketOrderAmount - TicketOrderCardFees-TicketOrderAdminFees
    Is the ticket active but the main ticketorderpack inactive?
    Is the ticket active but the main ticketorderproduct inactive
    Order ACTIVE, Ticket ACTIVE, Transactions are not COMPLETE 
    Is there a Test Transaction, but the order is Active not Test


For a total event's orders:
    Does the sum of TicketOrderCardFees + TicketOrderAdminFees match the (Sum Of TicketOrderTransactions - Sum of TicketOrderPacks)

Are there TicketOrders that been Cancelled but have Active TicketOrderPacks?

Are there TicketOrders that are ACTIVE but have Transactions that are TEST?

Output:
    Should this be a query run manually by dev team? Or is it something that we can download from Admin (that shows up for all events that have an end date later than today-3 months?
    We would need EventID, EventCode, TicketOrderID, Admin link to the TicketOrder, TicketORderName, TicketOrderTotalAmount, SumOfTikcetOrderPacks, SumOfTicketOrderTransactions, Reason it is in this list. Sort it by EventDateFinish

Anything else?

This has some sample queries I've used in the past, and I'm sure https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1199915143402373 has a set too

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Gfp2UlQSBGorf9ddvKex-IJT4_XakbKwZnmSkoL4a0s/edit#heading=h.u9jc0njgc194

Name: Auto-check of Data transformation data
Notes:
Data transformation service takes data from ExpoDB via expo bridge, combines messages and stores it in Postgres DB.

We want to ensure the data stored in the Postgres DB (eg Data transformation and Reporting services etc) is accurate when compared to ExpoDB.

There is ahttps://app.asana.com/0/1204858398617913/1207942333776259/ffor ensuring the integrity of the 'source' data in ExpoDB is good.

This card is about checking does Postgres DB match ExpoDB and Admin and Console reports.

    Total tickets (Qty and $)
    Main+Extra tickets (Qty and $)
    Addon Tickets (Qty and $)
    Fees charged to the visitor
    Total transaction (Qty and $)
        Charged
        Refunded
        Net
    How many paid transactions
    How many free transactions
    Total quantity of products 'sold' on a per product basis
    Total quantity and $ of packs 'sold' on a per pack basis
    Confirm attendance numbers are correct

$ should be checked in ex TAX and inc TAX terms

ie essentially we are checking everything on this report matches
https://admin.lup.com.au/Organiser/Report/Ticketing/ad80e0fd-b9f6-4dc3-a8f4-90834a8c0b5b

FUTURE: Check for Attendance accuracy etc.
Blocking (Dependencies): AFE & AFI- UTM code for each visitor registration

Name: IMARC / RT export UTM tags of ordres
Notes:
For RT and IMARC we need to regularly export UTM tags of orders

Paste the data https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-uWbf7qb39rsl5MMwPb0j_OjeIHbucROow35SK4p_iQ/edit#gid=0 and split the columns

This is source query:


SELECT
     CASE
           WHEN eventID = 2412 THEN 'IMARC'
           WHEN eventID = 2417 THEN 'RT'
           ELSE 'Unknown'
       END AS eventname,

    CASE
           WHEN ticketorderstatus = 'Active' THEN 'COMPLETE'
           ELSE 'INCOMPLETE'
       END AS ticketorderstatus,
    eventID,
       ticketorderID,
       ticketorderdatetime,
       ticketordername,
       ticketorderemail,
       ticketorderphone,
       ticketordercompany,
       landingURL, TicketOrderReferalSource,


       -- Extract and decode UTM_campaign
       CASE
           WHEN landingURL LIKE '%utm_campaign=%'
           THEN REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(
                   SUBSTRING(landingURL, CHARINDEX('utm_campaign=', landingURL) + 13,
                   CHARINDEX('&', landingURL + '&', CHARINDEX('utm_campaign=', landingURL)) - CHARINDEX('utm_campaign=', landingURL) - 13),
                   '%20', ' '), '%21', '!'), '%22', '"'), '%23', '#'), '%24', '$'), '%25', '%'), '%26', '&')
           ELSE NULL
       END AS UTM_campaign,
       -- Extract and decode UTM_medium
       CASE
           WHEN landingURL LIKE '%utm_medium=%'
           THEN REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(
                   SUBSTRING(landingURL, CHARINDEX('utm_medium=', landingURL) + 11,
                   CHARINDEX('&', landingURL + '&', CHARINDEX('utm_medium=', landingURL)) - CHARINDEX('utm_medium=', landingURL) - 11),
                   '%20', ' '), '%21', '!'), '%22', '"'), '%23', '#'), '%24', '$'), '%25', '%'), '%26', '&')
           ELSE NULL
       END AS UTM_medium,
       -- Extract and decode UTM_content
       CASE
           WHEN landingURL LIKE '%utm_content=%'
           THEN REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(
                   SUBSTRING(landingURL, CHARINDEX('utm_content=', landingURL) + 12,
                   CHARINDEX('&', landingURL + '&', CHARINDEX('utm_content=', landingURL)) - CHARINDEX('utm_content=', landingURL) - 12),
                   '%20', ' '), '%21', '!'), '%22', '"'), '%23', '#'), '%24', '$'), '%25', '%'), '%26', '&')
           ELSE NULL
       END AS UTM_content,
       -- Extract and decode UTM_term
       CASE
           WHEN landingURL LIKE '%utm_term=%'
           THEN REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(
                   SUBSTRING(landingURL, CHARINDEX('utm_term=', landingURL) + 9,
                   CHARINDEX('&', landingURL + '&', CHARINDEX('utm_term=', landingURL)) - CHARINDEX('utm_term=', landingURL) - 9),
                   '%20', ' '), '%21', '!'), '%22', '"'), '%23', '#'), '%24', '$'), '%25', '%'), '%26', '&')
           ELSE NULL
       END AS UTM_term
FROM ticketorders
WHERE eventID IN (2412, 2417)
  AND landingURL LIKE '%utm%'
ORDER BY eventID, ticketorderdatetime;

Name: Admin: Cancelled Tickets / Updated Email Report Requests by Client
Tags: Dev Team Request,ACCEPTED (Dev Team Request),Late Request
Notes:
Event: https://admin.lup.com.au/Event/EventDetail/2507

For this event the client is manually exporting data from Lup to Hubspot.

So they can ensure consistency between the two systems they need to know 
    Report showing which tickets were cancelled and when and if we do know include by which user  
    Report showing ticket emails updated oldemail and newemail

Could these reports be added to console, perhaps where Universal Reports downloads are, so that the organiser can see that information. 

Can this be added to admin/organiser/download tab please

They won't use our OAPI integration for this event and will be manually checking against our data exports from Admin and Hubspot.

Any queries please let me know.

OldEmail Newemail query from Neeshil


SELECT
     -- Extract OLD email
    SUBSTRING(
        logdetail,
        CHARINDEX('Email: OLD ', logdetail) + LEN('Email: OLD '),
        CHARINDEX(' NEW', logdetail, CHARINDEX('Email: OLD ', logdetail)) - (CHARINDEX('Email: OLD ', logdetail) + LEN('Email: OLD '))
    ) AS OldEmail,
    -- Extract NEW email
    SUBSTRING(
        logdetail,
        CHARINDEX('NEW ', logdetail, CHARINDEX('Email: OLD ', logdetail)) + LEN('NEW '),
        CHARINDEX(', ', logdetail, CHARINDEX('NEW ', logdetail, CHARINDEX('Email: OLD ', logdetail))) - (CHARINDEX('NEW ', logdetail, CHARINDEX('Email: OLD ', logdetail)) + LEN('NEW '))
    ) AS NewEmail

FROM log
INNER JOIN ticketorders ON ticketorders.ticketorderID = log.ticketorderID
    AND ticketorders.eventID = 2412
WHERE
  logitem = 'Update Visitor-EditVisitor'
    AND logdate >= '2024-10-19 00:00:00'
and logdetail is not null

ORDER BY logid ASC;

Name: Exhibitor Forms and Responses report
Notes:
select s.EventId,s.SurveyId, SurveyTitle as FormName, ExhibitorSurveyStatus, CompletionStatus,
 ExhibitorShortName, ExhibitorStand, ExhibitorContactName, ExhibitorContactEmail, ExhibitorContactPhone, ExhibitorCompanyName,
 q.question, d.[Value]
 from ExhibitorSurveys e
inner join Survey s on s.surveyid=e.surveyID
inner join EventExhibitors x on e.EventExhibitorID = x.EventExhibitorID
left join Answer a on a.surveyid=s.surveyid and a.ExhibitorSurveyGUID = e.ExhibitorSurveyGUID
left join AnswerDetails d on a.answerid = d.AnswerID
left join QuestionDetails q on q.QuestionDetailsID = d.QuestionDetailsID
where s.eventid=2451 and surveydevicemode=7
--and s.surveyid=50445
order by SurveyTitle, ExhibitorShortName

Events air integration
Notes:
https://admin.lup.com.au/Event/EventDetail/2489

Event starts 23rd November, but we need time to test the integration properly.

Hey Team,
The organiser is using Eventsair for registration / ticketing, before and during the event.

We need the ability for our lup app to scan and print badges from Events air.

They will be using Events Air pre and during the event. Anyone turning up onsite and wants to buy a ticket will buy through events air. 

Their data then api's to lup, allowing them to scan and print a badge.

Additionally we need to pull across all registration data of each visitor. This is due to exhibitors will be using lup hardware/app to scan exhibitor leads.

Note it would be good if we can re-use this integration with other events in the future too


https://developer.eventsair.com/docs/

Information from EventsAir so far.


On Thu, 12 Sept 2024 at 22:37, Nikita Gurung <n.gurung@eventsair.com> wrote:
Hi Lawrence,

I've had a chat with the team here internally and as the API is an Open API, the documentation available for using the API is the https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__developer.eventsair.com_docs_&d=DwMFaQ&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=jwSU_QrB71utaR27ChZtweUx9srKxVfDMjzrW6GB4C0&m=0Fsrk5f2vsPuBmZoFZtCUsFPOwqfi8wU-j1X1Xknibe_wX_8AcupWfJ6H5QumgnT&s=BmYMmiP4jFrXMIDMme3okGLgDkGOMyCNIVcqhwryH6M&e= link that I sent through on our call. I have been advised that this is detailed and gives a developer all details required to get started including how to issue querys and using apollo sandbox to get up to speed quickly. 

To get access to the API, Crypto will need to first complete the form linked here (I checked and saw that they have not signed up before): https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.eventsair.com_event-2Dmanagement-2Dsoftware_event-2Dintegrations_open-2Dapi-2Dsign-2Dup&d=DwMFaQ&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=jwSU_QrB71utaR27ChZtweUx9srKxVfDMjzrW6GB4C0&m=0Fsrk5f2vsPuBmZoFZtCUsFPOwqfi8wU-j1X1Xknibe_wX_8AcupWfJ6H5QumgnT&s=rTMtC4m3oN8Q2qiuOzueGoyz_iNaaaNS_PPOQo2ZOCs&e=

Once this is done, the support team will be in touch with further details to ensure that the API feature is enabled and setup correctly.

I have also had a chat with the team on how immediately the data is available in the API and they have advised that the developer would need to write in when tey want to pull the data, this could be hourly or daily, etc. If you have a look at the API documentation, it advised that there are usage limits on the API so you would just need to make sure that it doesn't exceed the limits set.

Lastly, I have been advised that the QR code data within EventsAir consists of a combination of two fields: ID and GUID and looks like this: ID,GUID  Both are generated by EventsAir that is available within the Open API.



On Fri, 13 Sept 2024 at 11:50, Cain Kirk <support@centium.zohosupport.com> wrote:

Hi Neeshil,

I'd recommend running the query on it's own for just one contact record, then check the response headers to see the cost of the query. I ran a similar query in my own even and found the cost was around 400, but this may differ depending on exactly what fields you need. Since there's an hourly limit of 1,000,000,  that query should be able to handle 2500 registrations in an hour, though there is also a limit of 750 HTTP requests per 5 minutes. The best practice for keeping the data up to date, would be to use webhooks so that the query can be run automatically when an attendee registers. In terms of how quickly the API updates, the data is available to query as soon as it is entered into the database, which typically is at most a few seconds after a site submission .
Cain Kirk
Software Support Consultant

 
Phone 1300 236 848




On Fri, 13 Sept 2024 at 12:45, Cain Kirk <support@centium.zohosupport.com> wrote:
Hi Neeshil,

The specific fields will depend what you mean exactly by 'status of the registrant', 'answers to their registration question' and 'product types of the registrant', I would recommend checking our schema reference to see if the exact fields are available https://developer.eventsair.com/docs/reference. But yes the webhook can be configured to run a query when someone registers
Cain Kirk
Software Support Consultant

Name: Duplicate Checks
Tags: Dev Team Request,ACCEPTED (Dev Team Request),Late Request
Notes:
https://admin.lup.com.au/Event/EventDetail/2417

Similiar to IMARC please run duplicate query to export list of duplicates.
The last list pulled for IMARC https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1r9tm8qs65pxFL4DnDEK5eqQMtiT7PxflCZMA0UrDFcM/edit?gid=0#gid=0
Please refer to the SQL tab for the query to run.

Card for reference https://app.asana.com/0/1206745480745770/1208545694179976/f



-- Duplicate Tickets
select ticketorderID, ticketID,  'https://admin.lup.com.au/organiser/ticket?o=' + cast(ticketorderID as nvarchar) as OrganiserLink,
https://admin.lup.com.au/ticket?o=' + cast(ticketorderID as nvarchar) as LupLink,
ticketfirstname,ticketlastname,ticketemail, ticketstatus, ticketpackname,
CASE when       tickets.TicketNotes like 'import%' then 'IMPORT' else '' end as Source
from Tickets
inner join ticketpacks on ticketpacks.ticketpackID=tickets.ticketpackID
where tickets.eventID=2412
and ticketstatus!='Deleted' and ticketstatus !='Pending' and ticketstatus !='Cancelled'
and ticketpackname not like '%gala%' and ticketpackname not like '%cancelled%'
and ticketfirstname + ticketlastname+ticketemail in
(
Select  ticketfirstname + ticketlastname+ticketemail
from tickets
inner join ticketorders on ticketorders.ticketorderID = tickets.ticketorderID
inner join ticketpacks on ticketpacks.ticketpackID = tickets.ticketpackID
where tickets.eventID=2412 and ticketorderstatus='Active'
and ticketstatus !='Pending' and ticketstatus !='Deleted' and ticketstatus !='Cancelled'
and ticketpackname not like '%gala%' and ticketpackname not like '%cancelled%'
group by ticketfirstname + ticketlastname+ticketemail
having count(ticketID) > 1
)
order by ticketlastname, ticketfirstname, ticketemail

Name: Partner Ticketing: Only allow 1 guest to cancel tickets per request
Ticketing - Check Stripe stamenet_descriptor
Notes:
Starting November 20, 2024, statement descriptors for card payments made via the PaymentIntents and Checkout Sessions APIs will be required to include the statement descriptor prefix that you’ve set in your https://59.email.stripe.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fdashboard.stripe.com%2Fb%2Facct_1MZnE5AOvJgbU0md%3Fdestination=https%253A%252F%252Fdashboard.stripe.com%252Fsettings%252Fupdate%252Fpublic%252Fsupport-details/1/01010192f878a66a-b664b57e-eab6-4bdd-8467-22cf82de55d9-000000/VAfo0Z6mrMx7pi9QLIg4HmC6jU5ZxVLY1d7mNyLoVsc=377. This prefix must clearly indicate your business name or DBA.
 

 
What this means for you
 

 
To accommodate this change, we’ve added the statement_descriptor_suffix parameter. After November 20, 2024, you’ll need to use statement_descriptor_suffix on card payments to define any characters that you’d like to appear alongside the prefix to form your dynamic statement descriptor.
 

 
Our records show you have set a dynamic Statement Descriptor on PaymentIntents in the past, however, no API requests have been made in the past 365 days to create a payment.
 

 
It will not be possible to add a dynamic statement descriptor to a card payment using the statement_descriptor parameter. As an alternative, you can omit the parameter entirely so that only the static prefix will be used.
 
 

 
 
Note that this change will only affect card payments made via the PaymentIntents and Checkout Sessions APIs when using a dynamic statement descriptor. If your integration does not set the statement_descriptor parameter at the time of payment, there’s no action required of you.
 

 
See our docs for more guidance on https://59.email.stripe.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fdocs.stripe.com%2Fget-started%2Faccount%2Fstatement-descriptors%23set-the-statement-descriptor-on-non-card-charges/1/01010192f878a66a-b664b57e-eab6-4bdd-8467-22cf82de55d9-000000/g_T1QMJbCih8B87njIsXR4kS01jT75vwU76nBdEvsnQ=377.
 

 
If you have any questions, please visit our https://59.email.stripe.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fsupport.stripe.com%2Fcontact%2Flogin/1/01010192f878a66a-b664b57e-eab6-4bdd-8467-22cf82de55d9-000000/jSFNJSHGs4_9St9XtAFwXVaeoorrwKjL-nAIo3rrMPU=377. We’re here to help.

Name: SXSW Room Scanners for post show reports
Notes:
For SXSW we have many ticket scanners being used at rooms

Staff onsite are scanning QR CODES stuck to the door with the label of the room

So we can visually compare the room name with the surveytitle


https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1n7eBWKoI8g0iHQrj0lvYYs6IPEFXEOkLKhlqOd5ahfA/edit?gid=0#gid=0


-- number of scans of qr codes at doors
select distinct
    survey.surveyID,
    surveytitle,EmperiaUsername,
    answer.longcode,
    count(answerID) as CountOfScans,
    case
        when emperiausername != answer.longcode
        then 'MISMATCH'
        else ''
    end as MatchStatus
from
    survey
inner join
    answer on answer.surveyID = survey.surveyID
where
    eventID = 2420
    and surveydevicemode = 5
    and len(answer.longcode) < 32
    and survey.surveyID not in (52197)
    and longcode != 'PUBLICATTENDEE'
    and longcode != 'cra'
    and longcode != 'privacy'
    and longcode not in (
        'F17DDFWFPLJT', 'F2N3TNB8NBK','FFMD85ZDPLJR','fr','httpenmwikipediaorg',
        'Lawrence','lpevents','qrtoorgunready','sxsw','SXSW-Sydney-2024?cat',
        'wwwhearingmattersaustraliaorg','x8egbyc','30840968942926RP', '3EDiYX3?r',
        '3PoC73V?r','6a68a789','7KU5VAZ1CR5R','86NJXNQP7JY','9345CDA3','B9WJ9N',
        'C200QN1ZZ11','C6KSJ0ZQHG7Q','C6KTWEL2HG7G','C8PXW0B2JC6H'
    )
group by
    survey.surveyID,
    surveytitle,EmperiaUsername,
    answer.longcode
order by
    surveytitle;

Name: SSL certificate for *.staging.lup.com.au expires in 90 days
Notes:
Hello,

Your SSL certificate for *.http://staging.lup.com.au/ is due to expire in 90 days. (email was sent on 26 Aug 2024)

This certificate will need to be replaced with a new SSL certificate. Please contact us for more information on the ordering process.

If you let your certificate expire any visitor to your website will be presented with an error message informing them that your website is insecure and in some cases may not even be able to see your website at all.

We recommend you contact us as soon as possible to ensure you can have your certificate renewed as soon as possible to avoid any potential downtime.

See you tonight at the ICC Grand Ballroom, Convention Level 5 from 6:45pm.


5 Tickets or more send 1 x SMS only:

Name: Fix Answer.longcode / barcode that is different with visitor.Longcode/Barcode
Notes:
How do these have different answer.longcode/answer.barcode to visitor.barcode/visitor.longcode ?

```select visitor.VisitorStatus, visitor.eventID, visitor.visitorID, firstname, lastname, email, visitor.barcode, visitor.longcode ,
       answer.barcode, answer.longcode, answer.answerID,
       tickets.ticketID, tickets.ticketorderID, tickets.ticketemail, tickets.TicketShortCode, tickets.ticketlongcode
from Visitor
inner join answer on answer.visitorID=visitor.VisitorID
left outer join tickets on visitor.visitorID=tickets.visitorID
where visitor.eventID=2457 and answer.barcode !=visitor.barcode```

Name: Leadscanner: Fix to focus issues on iphones
Notes:
For expo sdk 50, autofocus for iphones is off which means the focus is locked after the initial focus.
By turning it on and adding a double tap to refocus the camera we can be a bit more flexible if the barcode is not initially focussed on.
https://docs.expo.dev/versions/v50.0.0/sdk/camera/#autofocus


Note: this behaviour looks to change in the next major version.

Name: Corp Ticketing: Bulk upload for guest tickets including ticket types
Notes:
Partners have a set amount of allocated tickets.
Partners may choose to send x amount of tickets to their guests. (x is limited by achievable performance, we will know the limit after we analyze the metrics).
Partners can perform 1 operation at a time to avoid sending more tickets than they have allocated.
There is no shared state as of now, operation lock will work only with 1 instance running.

Start with looking at this method https://github.com/Lup-Events/Lup.CorporateTicketingService/blob/b207275046bb7becce44ad18c7c027fc93ebd16c/src/Lup.CorporateTicketingService.Web/Services/V1/CorporateTicketingService.cs#L603-L810

    each partner would download their own template file which would have the columns needed to fill in.  There would be 1 column per pack/product so they can fill in the quantity for each of those types
    Validation: Reject the whole file if not valid, but we need specific reasons why. eg "Row 10, firstname is missing" or "Row 5, has no quantities"

    Found that below query is the main cause
(@p__linq__0 nvarchar(4000))SELECT 
    [Extent1].[TicketID] AS [TicketID], 
    [Extent1].[TicketOrderID] AS [TicketOrderID], 
    [Extent1].[TicketPackID] AS [TicketPackID], 
    [Extent1].[EventID] AS [EventID], 
    [Extent1].[TicketShortCode] AS [TicketShortCode], 
    [Extent1].[TicketLongCode] AS [TicketLongCode], 
    [Extent1].[TicketQty] AS [TicketQty], 
    [Extent1].[TicketStatus] AS [TicketStatus], 
    [Extent1].[TicketNotes] AS [TicketNotes], 
    [Extent1].[VisitorID] AS [VisitorID], 
    [Extent1].[TicketFirstName] AS [TicketFirstName], 
    [Extent1].[TicketLastName] AS [TicketLastName], 
    [Extent1].[TicketEmail] AS [TicketEmail], 
    [Extent1].[TicketPhone] AS [TicketPhone], 
    [Extent1].[CouponID] AS [CouponID]
    FROM [dbo].[Tickets] AS [Extent1]
    WHERE ((LOWER([Extent1].[TicketLongCode])) = @p__linq__0) AND ([Extent1].[TicketStatus] IN ('Active','Verification'))

    Run SQL Script to Kill long-running SELECT sessions (script in the comment)

Name: IMPORT Bulk create Expo Passes for Gala Dinner tickets
Tags: Dev Team Request,ACCEPTED (Dev Team Request),Late Request
Notes:
For IMARC, for those who have a Gala dinner ticket (main ticket, not addon) we need to bulk create them an Expo Pass

Approval status should match the gala ticket
Send the confirmation email for the Expo Pass as well

This is the import file
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1BhXRBh3cm6QOCo5PFihOyoiCJu_ChTBOXJk1ZZPxrGM/edit?gid=0#gid=0


I used this query to find the ones that didn't have a ticket already




-- Gala tickets that don't have a non-gala pass
-- so we can bulk add them
select

    ticketorderdatetime as [Registered At], '' as [Discount Code], 0 as	[Balance Due]
    	, 0 as	[Net (Individual)], 0 as	[GST (Individual)], 0 as	[Total Amount (Include GST)], '' as	TicketOrderReferal
     ,

       ticketstatus as [Approval Status], 'Active' as [Payment Status],'Expo Visitor Pass*' as [Ticket Type],
       TicketFirstName as given_name, TicketLastName as family_name,  TicketEmail as email_address,
      company, position as [_163160_Job Title], TicketPhone as [cellphone]


from ticketproducts
inner join ticketorderproducts on ticketproducts.ticketproductid = ticketorderproducts.ticketproductID
inner join tickets on tickets.ticketID=ticketorderproducts.ticketID
inner join ticketorders on ticketorders.ticketorderID=tickets.ticketorderID
 inner join visitor on visitor.visitorID=tickets.visitorID
--left outer join GalaDinnerSeats on ticketorderproducts.ticketorderproductID = GalaDinnerSeats.TicketOrderProductID
         where Ticketproducts.eventID=2412
and ticketproductstatus='Active'
and ((ticketproductcode like '%gala%'and ticketproductcategory !='Addon' ))-- or ticketproductcode like 'government pass%')
and ticketstatus not in ('cancelled','pending')
and ticketorderstatus!='PEnding'
       --  and addonanswers  like '%No, I am no longer attending'
         --and badgeline4    not like  '%GALA ' + GalaDinnerSeats.Tablenumber + '%'
         and tickets.visitorid is not null
 and ticketemail not in (select TicketEmail as email
                         from ticketproducts
                                  inner join ticketorderproducts
                                             on ticketproducts.ticketproductid = ticketorderproducts.ticketproductID
                                  inner join tickets on tickets.ticketID = ticketorderproducts.ticketID
                                  inner join ticketorders on ticketorders.ticketorderID = tickets.ticketorderID
                              --  inner join visitor on visitor.eventID=2412 and  (visitor.firstname + visitor.lastname + visitor.email =  TicketFirstName + TicketLastName + TicketEmail)
--left outer join GalaDinnerSeats on ticketorderproducts.ticketorderproductID = GalaDinnerSeats.TicketOrderProductID
                         where Ticketproducts.eventID = 2412
                           and ticketproductstatus = 'Active'
                           and ((ticketproductcode not like '%gala%' and ticketproductcategory != 'Addon'))-- or ticketproductcode like 'government pass%')
                           and ticketstatus not in ('cancelled', 'pending')
                           and ticketorderstatus != 'PEnding'
                           --  and addonanswers  like '%No, I am no longer attending'
                           --and badgeline4    not like  '%GALA ' + GalaDinnerSeats.Tablenumber + '%'
                           and tickets.visitorid is not null)

-- Gala addon answers and government pass
-- to send dietary requirements email to
select tickets.ticketID, tickets.ticketorderid, ticketorderdatetime, ticketproducts.ticketproductID, ticketproductcode, ticketproductcategory,
       TicketFirstName as firstname, TicketLastName as lastname, TicketEmail as email, TicketPhone, ticketstatus, ticketorderproducts.AddOnAnswers
from ticketproducts
inner join ticketorderproducts on ticketproducts.ticketproductid = ticketorderproducts.ticketproductID
inner join tickets on tickets.ticketID=ticketorderproducts.ticketID
inner join ticketorders on ticketorders.ticketorderID=tickets.ticketorderID
         where Ticketproducts.eventID=2412
and ticketproductstatus='Active'
and ((ticketproductcode like '%gala%' and ticketproductcategory='Addon') or ticketproductcode like 'government pass%')
and ticketstatus not in ('cancelled','pending')
and ticketorderstatus='Active'
order by ticketorderdatetime

Name: IMARC sort out unicode characters
Notes:
Some imports had unicode characters.

Need to go back and manually update the name,email,phone,company, position on:
Visitor
Tickets
AnswerDetails (company and position)



-- visitor has NBSP or question marks
select
    v.Source,
    v.VisitorID,
    v.firstname,
    v.lastname,
    v.email,
        v.company as VisitorCompany,
    v.position as VisitorPosition,
    max(case when d.QuestionDetailsID = 163160 then d.Value end) as [163160_PositionDetails], -- Position from AnswerDetails
    max(case when d.QuestionDetailsID = 163161 then d.Value end) as [163161_CompanyDetails]  -- Company from AnswerDetails

from visitor v
inner join Answer a
    on v.VisitorID = a.VisitorID
left join answerdetails d
    on a.answerid = d.answerid
    and d.QuestionDetailsID in (163160, 163161) -- Filtering for position and company from AnswerDetails
where (v.company like '%?%'
       or v.position like '%?%'
       or v.firstname like '%?%'
       or v.lastname like '%?%'
       or v.email like '% %')
and v.eventID = 2412
group by v.source, v.VisitorID, v.firstname, v.lastname, v.email, v.company, v.position

Name: IMARC Unpaid process
Tags: Dev Team Request,ACCEPTED (Dev Team Request),Late Request,Critical
Notes:
As per basecamp https://3.basecamp.com/4144748/buckets/34064615/todos/7109530696

IMARC have sent promo codes out to their sponsors for redeeming tickets.  Some of these sponsors haven't yet paid.

Please pre-prepare the query so this can be actioned promptly

IMARC eventID 2412


So we want to:
     bulk update in our system those who have used the promo codes, from their existing pack/products to the 'unpaid' version of their packs and products.
    And also update the promo codes to point to the unpaid versions of the packs instead.

And then do the Vice-Versa once they have paid

Summary:
    If the promo code in that list was used on an order
        For Tickets, TicketOrder tables etc:
            So PackID 52751 changes to 57125
            ProductID 35334 changes to 38067
    Also update Coupon if promo code is in that list:
        Also the coupon.PackID will update if the promo code is in that list.


Applies to pack / products of  Delegate Pass - SPEX and Gala Dinner Ticket (x1) - Sponsor only.  

Delegate Pass - SPEX means:
    Delegate Pass - SPEX: https://admin.lup.com.au/TicketPack/Edit/52751
    SPEX Delegate Pass: https://admin.lup.com.au/TicketProduct/EditTicketProduct/35334

Delegate Pass - SPEX UNPAID means:
    Delegate Pass - SPEX (UNPAID) https://admin.lup.com.au/TicketPack/Edit/57125
    SPEX Delegate Pass (UNPAID) https://admin.lup.com.au/TicketProduct/EditTicketProduct/38067

Gala Dinner Ticket (x1) - Sponsor only means:
    Gala Dinner Ticket (x1) - Sponsor https://admin.lup.com.au/TicketPack/Edit/52863
    Gala Dinner Seat (x1) https://admin.lup.com.au/TicketProduct/EditTicketProduct/35335

A list of promo codes from Myranda will be supplied 7 days prior Tuesday 22nd October 3pm (Sydney time)

Any ticket that has matching Pack/Product that used these promo codes will get changed:
    Delegate Pass - SPEX will  get changed to Delegate Pass - SPEX (UNPAID) pack and product
    Gala Dinner Ticket (x1) - Sponsor will get changed to Gala Dinner Ticket (x1) - Sponsor (UNPAID) pack and product

All promo codes that are matching will get changed:
    The promo codes regardless will get changed from Delegate Pass - SPEX to Delegate Pass - SPEX (UNPAID) 
    The promo codes all will get changed from Gala Dinner Ticket (x1) - Sponsor to Gala Dinner Ticket (x1) - Sponsor (Unpaid)


48 hours prior (Friday 25th October 3pm (Sydney time)), we will receive a list of promo codes of who has PAID
    The reverse of the above will happen

Name: TEST SMART QR Codes + Replace Ticket Function
Notes:
On the Lup App for ticket scanning we have a replace ticket function.

It allows us to replace an 'online' ticket with a pre-printed onsite one.

We want this to be able to work with Smart QR Codes too.  Currently if we use SmartQR Code to replace ticket then it messes up when it gets to server as then we have two tickets with same longcode.

I would imagine that on the server side, when using replace ticket, if it's a smart QR Code is the 'replacement' ticket, then the server side actions should be different. ie cancel the existing SmartQRCode 'order' and 'ticket'. Update the ticketlongcode on that record (maybe prefix it with REPLACED_)

And then finish the replace ticket function


For Wristband Packs & Products we will be using the REPLACE TICKET function in the Lüp App with SMART QR Codes.

SMART QR Codes Exported in this Asana Card: https://app.asana.com/0/1206821388533283/1207862814593240/f

Customer Flow Onsite will be like so:
    Customer purchases Wristband Ticket Online via Lüp Ticketing Page
    Customer shows their Ticket PDF to onsite staff
    Onsite staff uses "Advanced Search" function on Ticket Survey in Lüp App to search the customer's name and find their ticket.
    Onsite staff uses "Check In" function
    Replace Ticket Function prompts the onsite staff to scan a SMART QR Coded Wristband to link a physical wristband to the customer's registration.
    Customer's can then scan the qr code on their wristband to register themselves

NOTES:
    Replace Ticket Function needs to work with SMART QR Codes
    Replace Ticket needs to work with UNREGISTERED Tickets
    Last event we used this at was 2310 PAX

Name: Handover documentation for Exhibitor Shop portal
IMARC Photo request if photo not uploaded
Notes:
In IMARC, we want users who have not yet submitted a photo to upload it

We have a separate card that did it https://app.asana.com/0/1204858398617913/1208394523219421/f

We need to check:
    Do all products that need the photo have it added
    Get a list of who doesn't have the photo and send a request
    Will the system work also for those who do not have it as ASK LATER? ie sometimes we do an import, so we don't get the photo, but we want to still ask them
    Because the products have approval required TRUE, does that mean if the ticket is not verification status, then they can't upload their photos?


-- IMARC products and if they are asking photo question

select ticketproductID, ticketproductcode, TicketProductName,      
 TicketProductStatus,       questiondetailsID, productquestions.Status,
 productquestions.IsAnswerLaterfrom TicketProducts
left outer join ProductQuestions on ticketproducts.ticketproductID = productquestions.ProductID and questiondetailsID=163332
where ticketproducts.eventID=2412 and ticketproductstatus='Active'
order by ticketproductcode



-- IMARC visitors that don't have a photo
select tickets.ticketID, tickets.ticketorderID, 
ticketstatus, ticketproductcode, ticketproductname, 
visitor.firstname, lastname, email, company, position, badgeline1,
 answerdetails.value
from Tickets   
 inner join ticketorderproducts on tickets.ticketID = ticketorderproducts.ticketID    
inner join ticketproducts on ticketorderproducts.ticketproductID=ticketproducts.ticketproductID
left outer join visitor on tickets.visitorID=visitor.VisitorID
left outer join answer on visitor.visitorID=answer.visitorID
left outer join answerdetails on answer.answerID = answerdetails.answerID and questiondetailsID=163332
where tickets.eventID=2412
and ticketstatus in('active','verification') -- should this be just verification?
and answerdetailsID is null
and tickets.visitorid is not null

Name: DEV - Postcode & Country Breakdown
Notes:
This is needed for post-show reporting and can be run once at the end of the event (it doesn't need to happen in real time)

Due date is set to the Friday 18th October, and we need to run this on the 21st October with the real data set

Please ensure scripts are prepared so this can be done in a timely manner post show

Currently when visitors register we get their postcodes and save these.

Post show, the organiser wants a breakdown of REGION (new question).  We don't want to have to ask the visitor for their REGION, can we automatically get this information based on the postcode and their state question which they already answer?

    NSW Regional
    NSW (other)
    QLD
    VIC
    TAS
    WA
    NT
    ACT
    SA
    Overseas
    Unknown

    NSW Regional means: Visitor's Postcode is from the NSW Regional Postcode list below
    NSW (other) means: Australian State: (questionID 164615) is NSW and postcode is NOT from the NSW Regional Postcode list below
    QLD, VIC, TAS, WA, NT, ACT or SA means: Australian state (questionID 164615) has a corresponding value in that State question.
    Overseas is: QuestionID 164613 and they answered something other than AUSTRALIA
    Unknown means: Didn't match any of the rules above

The https://admin.lup.com.au/QuestionDetail/EditQuestionDetail/174860 has been added (QuestionID 174860)

Name: Schedule a set amount of azure VMs for big events
Notes:
We want to avoid scale ups and scale downs of azure VMs during big events.
the main reason is that we want to be able to apply hotfixes very quickly if needed, with our current octopus setup we may end up with a lot of deployments happening concurrently during scale ups which would slow down the hotfix deployment.

examples:
    SXSW:
        7 machines
        from 1 day before event start
        to 1 day after event end
        total estimated cost increase for 9 days ~AUD250-400

    IMARC: 
        5 machines 
        from 1 day before event start
        to 1 day after event end
        total estimated cost increase for 5 days ~AUD100-200

Name: IMARC prepare Import scripts for use against template
Notes:
For IMARC we are expecting some imports to come in rushed and urgent. To make it easier for everyone, we have created a template file for the organiser use, and this will allow Dev team to pre-prepare import scripts.

    To help simplify things we have created https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1vyvXnoj-GIbqJn_WppN7ITyGAfyHNOM1 in google drive
    It has https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1H49pwz-VhUBZ_tence-6wSG9B4-RGdxLHUWak0gdUwI/edit?gid=0#gid=0

The organiser will duplicate the template and name it before adding in data.

To speed things along, can dev please prepare import scripts, assuming that the imports will be using this template in the future.

Please note:
    Copy in all ticket email addresses on to the Existing Registrations tab, before import, so we can see which email addresses already exist
    Do NOT import any tickets that already exist, unless it is a GALA DINNER SEAT type (see next section for more info on those)
    _52871_Addon_Gala Dinner Ticket - The PackID of the Gala addon is 52871
    Gala Table Number and Gala Dietary Requirements need to be inserted in the correct places (TicketOrderProducts table?)
    There are tabs for lookup for NATURE OF BUSINESS, COUNTRIES, COUNTRIES OTHER (which is in the Countries tab), TicketPackProducts (The value being entered by client is the TicketProductCode)
    Some tickets may need to be imported as UNPAID status as per the STATUS column
    There are columns at the end with the vlookup for values for TicketPackID, 	TicketProductID,	_163247_Primary nature of business,	_163165_Country_Australia,	_163166_Other_Country
    Double check the formulas, vlookups etc have not been tampered with before doing your import


GALA TICKET import
If the TICKET TYPE column is "GALA DINNER SEAT" then:
    Ignore the _52871_Addon_Gala Dinner Ticket column
