Name: Recover from outage - Repush SXSW & IMARC, AUSFITNESS, to make sure no data is missing from outage
Notes:
'-- select eventguid from event where EventName like '%Good Food%' and EventStatus = 'Active' and EventID >= 2363
-- select * from event where Clientid = 4373 and EventStatus = 'Active' and EventDateFinish > '2024'
-- select count(*) from tickets where eventid in (select eventid from event where Clientid = 4373 and EventStatus = 'Active' and EventDateFinish > '2024')

-- select EventName, EventID, EventTicketingRegistrationSurveyID from event where eventid in (2412,2417)

-- select * from QuestionDetails where surveyid in (47513, 47818) and QuestionCSVStatus = 1 and QuestionTypeID in (1, 2, 3, 4, 15, 16, 17, 18, 20, 23, 24 )

-- select * from QuestionType
declare @Enumerator table (id int)
insert into @Enumerator
select eventid
from event
where eventid in (2420,  2412,  2417, 2457)

--Clientid = 4373 and EventStatus = 'Active' and EventDateFinish > '2024'

declare @eventid int
while exists (select 1
from @Enumerator)
begin 
    select top 1
        @eventid = id
    from @Enumerator

    -- DECLARE @eventid int = 2051
    DECLARE @groupSize int = 1

    -- -- For RefreshEvents
    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    VALUES( CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)), 0, GetUTCDate(), null, 0, 'RefreshEvents', '', '{ids:['+CAST(@eventid AS VARCHAR(5))+']}')


    -- For RefreshClients
    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshClients',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(ClientID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            ClientID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY ClientID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            Survey
        WHERE 
            eventid = @eventid AND ClientID IS NOT NULL
    ) r
    GROUP BY 
    GroupNumber

    -- For RefreshTicketStores
    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshTicketStores',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(TS_ID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            TS_ID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TS_ID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            TicketStores
        WHERE 
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY 
    GroupNumber

    -- For EventDateTime
    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshEventDateTimes',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(EventDateTimeID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            EventDateTimeID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY EventDateTimeID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            EventDateTime
        WHERE 
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY 
    GroupNumber


    -- For RefreshSurveys
    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshSurveys',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(SurveyID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            SurveyID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY SurveyID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            Survey
        WHERE 
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY 
    GroupNumber

    -- For RefreshQuestionDetails
    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshQuestionDetails',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(QuestionDetailsID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            QuestionDetailsID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY QuestionDetailsID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            Survey
            JOIN QuestionDetails ON QuestionDetails.SurveyID = Survey.SurveyID
        WHERE 
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY 
    GroupNumber

    -- For RefreshQuestionOptions
    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshQuestionOptions',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(OptionID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            OptionID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY OptionID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            Survey
            JOIN QuestionDetails ON QuestionDetails.SurveyID = Survey.SurveyID
            JOIN QuestionOptions ON QuestionDetails.QuestionDetailsID = QuestionOptions.QuestionDetailsID
        WHERE 
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY 
    GroupNumber

    -- For RefreshTicketPacks

    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshTicketPacks',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(TicketPackID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            TicketPackID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TicketPackID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            TicketPacks
        WHERE
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY    
    GroupNumber

    -- For RefreshTicketProducts

    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshTicketProducts',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(TicketProductID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            TicketProductID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TicketProductID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            TicketProducts
        WHERE
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY    
    GroupNumber

    -- For RefreshTicketPackProducts

    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshTicketPackProducts',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(TicketPackProductID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            TicketPackProductID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TicketPackProductID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            TicketPackProducts
        WHERE
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY    
    GroupNumber


    -- For RefreshCoupons
    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshCoupons',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(CouponID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CouponID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY CouponID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            Coupons
        WHERE 
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY 
    GroupNumber

    -- For RefreshTicketOrderPacks

    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshTicketOrderPacks',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(TicketOrderPackID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            TicketOrderPackID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TicketOrderPackID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            TicketOrderPacks
            JOIN TicketOrders ON TicketOrderPacks.TicketOrderID = TicketOrders.TicketOrderID
        WHERE
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY
    GroupNumber


    -- For RefreshTicketOrderCoupons

    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshTicketOrderCoupons',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(TicketOrderCouponID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            TicketOrderCouponID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TicketOrderCouponID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            TicketOrderCoupons
            JOIN TicketOrders ON TicketOrderCoupons.TicketOrderID = TicketOrders.TicketOrderID
        WHERE
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY
    GroupNumber



    -- For RefreshTicketOrderProducts

    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshTicketOrderProducts',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(TicketOrderProductID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            TicketOrderProductID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TicketOrderProductID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            TicketOrderProducts
            JOIN TicketOrders ON TicketOrderProducts.TicketOrderID = TicketOrders.TicketOrderID
        WHERE
            eventid = @eventid
    ) r
    GROUP BY
    GroupNumber

    -- For RefreshTicketOrderTransactions

    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshTicketOrderTransactions',
        '',

            JOIN TicketOrders ON TicketOrderTransactions.TicketOrderID = TicketOrders.TicketOrderID

    -- For RefreshGalaDinnerSeats
    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),

    -- For RefreshAnswerDetails

        SELECT DISTINCT
            VisitorID,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY VisitorID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            tickets
        WHERE 
            EventID = @eventid AND VisitorID IS NOT NULL
    ) r
    GROUP BY 
    GroupNumber

    -- For RefreshTickets
    INSERT ExpoBridge
        (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json])
    SELECT
        CONVERT(UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, '1' + SUBSTRING(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(36),NEWID()), 2, 35)),
        0,
        GETUTCDATE(),
        null,
        0,
        'RefreshTickets',
        '',
        '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(Ticketid AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}'
    FROM
        (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            Ticketid,
            CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY Ticketid) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber
        FROM
            tickets
        WHERE 
            eventid = @eventid 
    ) r
    GROUP BY 
    GroupNumber


    delete from @Enumerator where id = @eventid
end

Name: DOCX Merge fields for long/med/short Badges and PAH
Tags: Dev Team Request,ACCEPTED (Dev Team Request),Late Request,Critical
Notes:
For Plastic Badge printing and Colour Badge printing, TicketPDF we have merge fields for

    VisitorFirstName
    VisitorLastName
    Company
    Position

I think that's it.

But because the word merge doesn't support dynamic font sizing, we encounter issues when the name is long or company is long.

I propose we keep these existing four fields but also create new ones:

    Long_FirstName
    Long_LastName
    Long_Company
    Long_Position
    Med_FirstName
    Med_LastName
    Med_Company
    Med_Position
    Short_FirstName
    Short_LastName
    Short_Company
    Short_Position

If FIRSTNAME or LASTNAME are more than 20 characters then these are populated
    Long_FirstName and Long_LastName
    Empty: Med_FirstName,  Med_LastName, Short_FirstName, Short_LastName

If FIRSTNAME or LASTNAME are between than 12 and 19 characters inclusive then then these are populated:
    Med_FirstName,  Med_LastName
    Empty: Long_FirstName and Long_LastName, Short_FirstName, Short_LastName

If FIRSTNAME and LASTNAME are both less than 12  characters   then then these are populated:
    Short_FirstName, Short_LastName
    Empty: Long_FirstName and Long_LastName, Med_FirstName,  Med_LastName

Company and Position we will do the same.

This means that on the template, we can set larger font for the shorter names, and smaller font for the longer names.  It will also help the ticket PDF for print at home badges.

Ideally there is event parameter for specifying the 12 and 20 character cut off values.  And separate parameter for Name, Company, Position

And separate parameters for Plastic Badge and Colour Badge
eg perhaps

PlasticBadgeFieldLength_Name: 12, 20
PlasticBadgeFieldLength_Company: 12, 20
PlasticBadgeFieldLength_Position: 12, 20
ColourBadgeFieldLength_Name: 12, 20
ColourBadgeFieldLength_Company: 12, 20
ColourBadgeFieldLength_Position: 12, 20
TicketPDFFieldLength_Name: 12, 20
TicketPDFFieldLength_Company: 12, 20
TicketPDFFieldLength_Position: 12, 20

That way we can customise it for Ticket PDF's as well (particularly Print at Home Badges) and also the plastic badge and colour badge

Name: Approval History Updates
Notes:
Show previous visitors that were:
    Rejected (ie cancelled AND has a rejected log)
    Downgraded (might be Active or Cancelled)
    Cancelled (ie cancelled but no rejected or downgraded log)
    Approved (ie it has approval in logs and is active)
For cancelled, it might have been previously approved or downgraded, so we need to show both the words of 'Approved' and the fact that it is now cancelled. 

I think we tweak it to this format:

EventCode: TicketProductCode - LogDate (or TicketOrderDate if no LogDate): TicketStatus (Approval Status by Username)
    TicketStatus: 
        If either Order or Ticket is Cancelled then show Cancelled
        Verification, Active, Cancelled would generally be the values
    Approval Status:
        N/A if there is no log record
        REJECTED
        DOWNGRADED
        APPROVED

That way we can see the ticket status and also if it was rejected approved downgraded or no active approval step.



In the Previous Events, include tickets that exist but were not part of approval process
eg 2310-IMARC: 3 Day Delegate - 15 September 2023 (Cancelled) (show this line in red)
2310-IMARC: Investor Speaker Pass - 15 September 2023 (Active)  (show this line in blue as it's an active ticket)

    Edit ALL details in a customer's record (including contact details, registration details)
    Update Pack & Product

To do this we need to tidy up the ADMIN permissions, so that the SHOW CSV and SHOW FINANCIALS Admin permissions are effective in admin/organiser screens

            User is linked to SXSW (not to Lup/ExpoNews)
            If SHOW CSV is FALSE, then in https://admin.lup.com.au/Organiser/Home/EventDownloads/90ad0cf8-dee6-44ee-985b-323c67685b14 link they should not see any items
            If SHOW FINANCIALS is false then https://admin.lup.com.au/Organiser/Report/Ticketing/90ad0cf8-dee6-44ee-985b-323c67685b14 should be not accessible / empty  and the main https://admin.lup.com.au/Organiser/Home/EventDetail/90ad0cf8-dee6-44ee-985b-323c67685b14  page should not have any financials showing
            SHOW TICKETS might be set as true
            That way this type of user can access SXSW, access the ticket, use the approval page, view the details, edit the ticket holder and change the packs and products for that clientcode, but can't see the financials

Name: Backfill Unreg Tickets
Notes:
'--Find Tickets that dont have visitor created
 SELECT e.eventid, e.EventDateFinish, EventName, COUNT(t.TicketId)
 --TicketOrderDateTime, EventDateFinish,EventName, t .*
 FROM Tickets t
 INNER JOIN ticketorders o ON o.TicketOrderID = t.TicketOrderID
 INNER JOIN TicketPacks pa ON pa.TicketPackID = t.TicketPackID
 INNER JOIN EVENT e ON e.eventid = o.eventid
 --LEFT JOIN #AnswerLogTemp a ON a.TicketOrderId = t.TicketOrderID AND LogDetail LIKE '%'+t.TicketFirstName +'%'
 --AND LogDetail LIKE '%'+t.TicketLastName +'%' AND LogDetail LIKE '%'+t.TicketEmail +'%'
 WHERE pa.TicketPackLevel=1
 AND t.TicketStatus='active' AND o.TicketOrderStatus = 'active'
 AND t.visitorid IS NULL AND t.TicketFirstName IS NOT NULL AND TicketFirstname != ''
 AND (t.TicketNotes IS NULL OR t.TicketNotes NOT LIKE '%Nasty Canasta%')
 AND e.EventDateFinish >'2024-01-23 08:00:00.00'
 AND e.EventTicketingRegistration='required'
 GROUP BY e.eventid, e.EventDateFinish, EventName
 ORDER BY e.EventDateFinish

https://lupevents.slack.com/archives/C0MT9NY3Z/p1725922338394249

dev note
-- no ticket data
select t.ticketid, a.Longcode, a.Barcode, a.surveyid from Answer a
inner join survey s on a.Surveyid = s.surveyid
left join tickets t on t.eventid = s.eventid and (t.ticketlongcode = longcode or barcode= ticketshortcode)
where s.eventid =2354 and a.deviceid not in (104,622)
and (len(longcode) > 30 or len(Barcode) > 4)
and t.ticketid is null
group by t.ticketid, a.Longcode, a.Barcode, a.surveyid

-- no registration data (unreg ticket)
select t.ticketid, a.Longcode, a.Barcode, a.surveyid from Answer a
inner join survey s on a.Surveyid = s.surveyid
inner join tickets t on t.eventid = s.eventid and (t.ticketlongcode = longcode or barcode= ticketshortcode)
where s.eventid =2354 and a.deviceid not in (104,622)
and (len(longcode) > 30 or len(Barcode) > 4)
and t.visitorid is null 
group by t.ticketid, a.Longcode, a.Barcode, a.surveyid

Name: DEV - Approvals - show approval status for last year
Notes:
As security company
I want to easily know if I approved this registrant last year
So that I can more quickly and effectively process approvals

For security approval events such as AMDA and IMARC, many visitors return year on year.

It would be useful for the security company, when viewing a person this year, to see a summary of what their previous registrations (for this client only), if they were rejected or approved.  (Note only for registrations that were actively went through approval process. If it was 'active' because they were an import or didn't require approval process, don't show this)

It will match on Firstname + Lastname + Email

AND/OR the face signature of this registrations photo vs ANY registration in the system for that client - we should show the approval status for previous years, and also highlight if the name or email is different. To assist with security process. (Can be separate card if need be)

Also it should show if there any from this year approved or rejected as well.

Name: Dev: Need the ability to upload Photo ID once registered
Notes:
There are two parts to this:
    Organiser has ability to upload a new photo for a registration (I believe this is already done?)
    Visitor can either upload a new photo to replace a photo in an existing registration, or visitor uploads a photo for a registration that previously didn't have one.

This card is for hte 2nd one

This came up  with IMARC and also I know it's something we've wanted previously re:AMDA

Can we have a method for visitors to upload their PhotoID after registration?

eg these scenarios:
    Scenario 1: We may receive registrations via API and they don't have photos attached.  And want these people to now come back and upload photos
    Scenario 2: Registrations via an Import, and don't have photos, but we want to email them to ask them to upload the photos after we do the import.
    Scenario 3: A sales team may register visitors directly (with organiser ticketing, or a shortened registration form, that does NOT ask the photo to be uploaded at time of registrations), and we want those registrants to securely upload photo ID later after the sales team has registered

I would imagine something like:
    Tag a ProductQuestion (?????) that Photo question is upload later not on initial registration
    THIS CARD: 
        No photo submitted previously: A page (Eg on m.lup) that will allow them to upload their photo (if none already submitted) . 
        Photo already exists:  If the product has APPROVALS REQUIRED, then  Re-upload photo should only work if it's verification status, otherwise don't allow them to upload a new photo. ("Sorry this ticket is already approved and the photo can not be replaced")
        Photo already exists: If the product does NOT have approvals required, then they can re-submit a new photo regardless of ticket status.
    Trigger that when a new ticket registered and product has that special tag, it sends a separate email with a template "To complete your registration please click here to securely upload your photo"
    FUTURE CARD: Have a Manual button we can press to send reminders to all those who haven't yet submitted their photo
    SEPARATE CARD: Report/download that shows us who has not yet done it
    Page where they can actually upload this photo ID etc
    in MQUEUE make it a separate MessageType. eg "TicketPhotoRequest" or something similar.
        Have a default template, but allow eventparameter to supply a custom template for that event.


----------------------------------------

THIS CARD:
    Add new field ProductQuestion.AnswerLater bit default false
    Put the new field in TicketProduct - ProductQuestion grid maintenance https://admin.lup.com.au/TicketProduct/EventProduct/2412


We require the ability to manually upload an image to an active registration in Admin.
Currently there is no option to upload an image after the time of registration.
The organiser will be providing lists to upload which we may upload images of photo ID against at a later date.
It also gives us the option to override an existing image if required.

Name: IMARC Auto Approve query
Notes:
Can we have this run daily (or possibly once per hour)

This is for IMARC 2024 (ID 2412) and RT2024 (ID 2417)

Note: IMARC 2023 is ID 2253 and RT2023 is 2274


As Organiser
I want people who were security cleared last year by Jody to be auto-approved this year
So that it saves time and money in security approvals process

After someone registers the system should check:
    If it is "verification "status
    And not in a list of 'dont auto-approve' products
        ProductCode not like '%rejected%' and productCode not like '%pending%'
    Email address is not a throaway email or generic email (eg hotmail, QQ, gmail etc)
        We can have a list of domains
        This sheet has the updated list of domains to exclude. Only where there is a yes
        
        https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1KvLvS4zgnjdBaAXbv1VWXgTq-6ykPPsqHhlU0kn3d0M/edit
    Email address domain is not:
        Lup.events
        https://lup.com.au
        https://beaconevents.com
        https://amda.com.au
    Event has enabled "Auto-verification"
    Check active tickets on active orders from last years events that had been through a verification process. (ie they were manually approved) (IMARC 2023 is ID 2253 and RT2023 is 2274)
        If in previous year it was security approved 
    Update the status (ie auto-approve it)
    Log that this was auto-approved SELECT distinct l.* FROM LOG l WHERE LogModule='Approval' AND LogItem ='Auto Approved'
    Do NOT send ticket order or reminder email
    Send the ticket email again (Auto-verification setup should have this on / off)
    Push to OAPI

 


generic email list:
-- top email domains in our system
SELECT top 100 SUBSTRING ([Email], CHARINDEX( '@', [Email]) + 1,
LEN([Email])) AS [Domain], count(visitorID)
FROM visitor where eventID <2000 and visitorstatus='ACtive'
             and email not like '%.gov.%'
group by SUBSTRING ([Email], CHARINDEX( '@', [Email]) + 1,
LEN([Email]))
order by count(visitorID) desc

Name: ON HOLD IMPORTER: Wix/Scanner orders in to Admin
Notes:
Currently we receive orders for scanners in WIX.  The team then manually downloads the CSV file from WIX and enters one by one in to Admin.  This is a slow and tedious process which is burning up time for our team.

    We want a more effective way to create orders and surveys and users and sending logins

For this first milestone, all we are interested in is to import the file as an order in admin and future milestones can create the surveys, users and logins.

Importer as first step, not API integration
Should this be automated via API?


Milestone 1:
    1. Go in to Console
    2. Select Scanner Orders
    3. It should list the scanner orders that are currently in the event
    4. Import button - that allows uploading or download a sample template
    NOTE: Import template as per Dev teams requirements
    5. Strict validation on fields (like visitor importer)
    Populate EventOrder table, EventOrderProducts, Surveys table
    The rest of the process can be done manually by Sales team
    Survey: Create them all as DeviceMode specified in the import CSV file
    6. Show a completion page/ finished page

Sample Import CSV file:
    OrderDateTime
    OrderTotal
    Contact Firstname
    Contact Lastname
    Email
    Mobile
    Company
    Tax Number (eg ABN) - Optional
    Stand number
    Stand Name
    ProductsOrdered (import this in to NOTES) field
    Questions: No or Yes. (Blank means none)
    Type: Hardware or App (Blank means Hardware)
    Quantity: Numeric (blank means 1)

Name: Buy more get more discount
Notes:
Some times Lup wants to be able to offer deals such as 

Buy 3 scanners get 150 off  or Each scanner you buy up to 5 will get 50 off with a max discount of $250

Therefore we want to 

    add 3 cols to the event products table PerUnitDiscountAmountInc, MinQtyForPerUnitDiscountAmount, MaxQtyForPerUnitDiscountAmount. 
    On the eventorder table add a OrderTotalDiscount 
    on EventOrderProducts add EOPTotalDiscountInc

Update the exisibitorShop App 

When saving EventOrderProducts, we save the original unit price, discount & totalPrice, separately 

When working out the price it becomes 

    EOPTotalDiscountInc = Calcate Discount
    EOPTotalPriceInc = (UnitPriceInc * Qty) - Discount
    EOPUnitPriceEx = UnitPriceEx

Ensure these new fields are customisable in admin

select  id

,mt_version
,mt_dotnet_type

where data ->> 'PaymentDescription' like '%Exhibitor Shop Order%'

Name: Lup.Intergrate - New OAPI
Notes:
Steps 

We require a new oapi to allow us to integrate other 3rd party systems with Lup data

The steps we need todo is 

    Update expo bridge
        Add new props
        Add coupon
        Add TicketStores
        Add ticketorderCoupons
        Add ticketorderpacks
    Data Transformation
        Rename summary from visitor to ticket
        fix tests and make sure that we have test on the wire up to ensure no missed props
        Add props 
        Add Coupon
        Add TicketOrderCoupons
        Add TicketOrderPacks
        Add TicketStores
        Wire up extra props into TicketSummary
        Wire up extra props into SurveySummary
        Write up extra props into EventSUmmary
        Write up extra props into EventSummry
        Add Sync Check
    Integrate
        Sub to new summaries
        Implement Data Transformation to Integrate summaries 
        Add Api endpoints with correct auth checks

Name: Deploy Exhibitor Shop to prod
[CRITICAL] Coyote: Adding basic authentication to nuget on coyote server
Notes:
Critical Risk - no auth on our nuger server.

Code packages, config and passwords are available via Unauthenticated NuGet Endpoint
CRITICAL RISK!

• https://coyote.lup.com.au/nuget/
• https://coyote.lup.com.au/nuget/Packages
Potential Security Issue:
• All compiled source code deployed via Coyote is available to the internet via an unauthenticated endpoint
• All secret, keys, passwords and credentials within the source code config files are available for public access.


https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/iis/configuration/system.webserver/security/authentication/basicauthentication

Solution: Add basic auth to nuget/packages folder
https://coyote.lup.com.au/nuget/Packages

Steps:
• Restore Coyote.Lup IIS Application should critical systems be impacted
    o Back up all packages
    o Deregister packages from the server
    o Move packages outside the applications virtual folder.
    o Backup/Remove packages after deployment.
• Adding authentication to Nuget
• Test deployment infrastructure
• Review logs to determine if any historical authorised access can be determined
• Unless it can be confirmed that any access is highly unlikely, and any risks are accepted:
    o Audit all secrets within nuget package config files and code deployed in the server.
    o Roll all secrets.
    o Remove secrets from configuration files.
    o Remove secrets from source code.
    o Roll all secrets again.
There are related card to remove secret from config and sourcecode.

Hey Team

I have a fun one for us. 

In regards to badges (both printed and PDF tickets/P@H badges), if someone has a "conference" addon, and they are holding a Trade Visitor or Defence Visitor product, the Badgeline 1 text needs to change to be the addon badge text.

If they have a conference addon, and for example a "contractor" product, then the badgeline 1 text should remain as detailed for the Contractor product. 

    Defence Visitor + Conference (addon) = DELEGATE (and do not show Delegate in badgeline 2)
    Trade visitor + Conference (addon) = DELEGATE (and do not show Delegate in badgeline 2)
    Defence Visitor + not having a Conference (Addon) = DEFENCE
    Trade Visitor + not having a conference (addon) = TRADE
    CONTRACTOR + Conference (addon) = CONTRACTOR etc

Any other addons should appear on the badgeline2 as per normal.

DEV - SXSW DOCUMENTATION Provide OptIn
Notes:
On behalf of the organiser we are storing the opt-in preferences for communications sent by organiser to the user.

They may update their preferences on organiser website and these preferences get pushed to us

Also organiser will read us as the source of truth

SXSW Website and their API integrator will check this information:

Many of these will initially come from Registration flow.

    Opt-ins for SXSW : 
        Email:
        SMS
    Partner Offers 

    Global to the client (as opposed to specific to the event)


For only people who have a Lup SXSW account (Assume this for now)

Do we need to check if email / phone is 'verified' or not?
API level for managing this
Lup UI for managing this at the client level


----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------


Allow SXSW website to send optin preferences for a user.

Creating a communications service which has the role of managing opt-ins and sending communications to people who interact with Lup.

Assumed that default behaviour is to opt-in.

Endpoints for Opt-out is a:
/GET that takes a hash of the touchpoint (sms, email) that returns an enum of unknown/allowed to send/do not sent marketing communication/do not send any communication.

/GET/{clientid} (FOR A CLIENT) that takes a hash of the touchpoint (sms, email) that returns an enum of unknown/allowed to send/do not sent marketing communication/do not send any communication.

/POST/UPSERT/{clientId} 
BODY {touch point hash, enum of unknown/allowed to send/do not sent marketing communication/do not send any communication}.
This endpoint takes the touchpoint hash and sets the communication flag, we might need logic to manage whether the user is allowed to opt-in/out for that touchpoint.

For auth, endpoint /GET and /GET/{clientid} is anonymous so we enable thirdparty services to easily integrate with us where they are unable to create an oidc client that can auth against us.

For additionally security, we could also require them to hash the touch point and the client id when sending the /GET, but this may not be necessary.

Name: UPDATE: Already Have A Ticket function
Notes:
For events with add ons / extras we set up a pack/product on the main ticketing page that allows customers to purchase an Add On / Extra separately without needing to purchase a Main Ticket.

However, customers are not enforced to select an Add On and can proceed to checkout without selecting any tickets, yet they still receive a ticket confirmation email, misleading the customer into assuming they have a ticket for the event, when in fact, they have NO tickets and spent $0.00

Product: https://admin.lup.com.au/TicketProduct/EditTicketProduct/35056

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1207478447649849

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1207478447649853

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1207478447649857

Name: DEV - SXSW Documentation for Registration data new OAPI
Notes:
With SXSW they are already using new Auth to get in to the new API endpoints

We currently have OAPI which is showing it's age.

We need to have a new version that's suitable to take us in to the next 10 years.

First step is a REGISTRATION end point


    GUID
    Visitor.Firstname
    Visitor.Lastname
    Visitor.Email
    Visitor.Postcode
    Visitor.PhoneNumber
    Ticket ProductCode (New TicketProductAPICode if that exists, else ProductCode)
    TicketProductType
    Answers
        Question (SvcQuestionTitle if that is populated)
        Answer (Answer.Value? Or do we get latest QuestionOption.value?_
    Addons (if there are)
        productCode
        productType
    atEvent
    TicketStatus
    Longcode (only if event setting is true)
    ModifiedDateTime
    RegistrationDateTime

Questions:
    If a visitor has no tickets, do they still come through? How do we show that
    Registration is cancelled, how do we show?
    Registration disconnected from a ticket?
    Addon is removed or cancelled from a ticket? (ie Might move addons from John to Sally)
    Upgrades, downgrades etc

We won't worry about $$ values etc at this stage, we need to think how we want to best represent that information

No ticketOrderer data either

Similar to OAPI https://oapi.lup.com.au/

NOTE: at this point it would be paginated, list API.  In the future we would do a webhook version of this


OAPI of:
    YES Tickets  - registered and unregistered. Also tickets that were active and now cancelled.
    YES Order information
    YES Transaction Information
    What about incomplete 

This is the API of OrdersAPI, showing:

    Tickets and the registration info (including unregistered tickets) 
        Packs, products (API Specific: Pack_API_code and Product_API_Code (field exists already))
        Questions have (API Specific: Question_API_code (new field and backfill). and Option_API_code (new field and backfill)) 
        Security Approval status etc, and rejection reason
        Unpaid orders should come through .
        Order purchase date

        Promo Codes used
        Order information (UTM, Ref, Status)
            OrderGUID
            Order name
            Order email
            Order phone
            Order company
            Order.ReferalSource etc
            Milestone 3: If we sell Gala dinner table of 10 for $5,000. This has 10 x tickets each $500.  How will this be in the API? Can have it showing against the ticket ticketOrderPack) that this is $500. (ie a derived value)
    FUTURE Transactions
        FUTURE Line items
    FUTURE Scans of the tickets
    FUTURE: Data segments associated with that order/ticket/answers/scans etc
    INCLUDED Cart abandonment info -  ie if an order abandoned, then the ticketorder details and/or if they had submitted registration info and clicked continue, that registration information as well
        IsIncomplete (1 hour after order starts, if it's not completed then push it to API as "Incomplete")
        Visitor registration information too (if it saves) - is it saving on the way through?
    VERY NEAR FUTURE: Separate end points for: "As integrator I want to know information about the event setup so that I can prepare the integration"
        Registration Survey details: questions,  options. (with ID's, status, API Codes etc)
        Packs.   Pack is how we sell it
        Products.    Product is what we sell
        PacksProducts: ID's and API_codes and how many of each are sold and availability and stock level/sold out
        Products
            Sold In: (ie packs), Qty of the product, PackProductId, Future: Qty sold
        Events end point

In future, we need to move to a Ticket <→ Order relationship will be many to many
Ticket Order has many tickets
Ticket Order has 1 or more transactions
Transaction has 1 or more LineItems

in essence a Transaction is a different tax invoice

Name: Sales Figures on Event List - Superadmin and Organiser view
Notes:
This is blocking us from closing YELLOW

As Event Organiser
When I view my event list I want to see a snapshot of sales $
So that I can see multiple event sales performance at a glance


Let's just hit the database directly every 15 mins for PBC only (client ID = 390)
    Only for events that are finishing in the future or have finished in the last month

Here are queries for total tickets and total $ of packs.  You'll need to create a 'today' version of these.
    Total sales $
    Today sales $
    Total qty 
    Today qty
    "Today" means 00:00 eventlocaltime based on TicketOrderDateTime + EventLocalTimeOffset

Then just wire them up into the Event list so only PBC get these numbers.

    IMPORTANT: Event Organiser only for their own event!
    IMPORTANT: That have FINANCE permission on their User->Client permission setting for console


-- active tickets on active orders  for PBC
select tickets.eventID, eventcode, count(TicketID)
from tickets
inner join ticketorders on ticketorders.ticketorderId=tickets.ticketorderID
inner join event on event.eventID=ticketorders.eventID
where event.clientID=390
and tickets.ticketstatus='Active'
and ticketorderstatus='Active'
group by tickets.eventID, eventcode
order by eventcode

-- sum of $ of active ticketpacks on active orders for PBC
select  ticketorders.eventID, eventcode, sum(ticketorderpacks.TicketOrderPackPrice)
from ticketorderpacks
inner join ticketorders on ticketorders.ticketorderId=ticketorderpacks.ticketorderID
inner join event on event.eventID=ticketorders.eventID
where event.clientID=390
 and ticketorderpacks.ticketorderpackstatus='Active'
and ticketorderstatus='Active'
group by ticketorders.eventID, eventcode
order by eventcode

Name: [TOCHECK] Deprecation of Amazon RDS M4, R4, and T2 database instance types on MySQL, MariaDB, and PostgreSQL [AWS Account: 766365401972] [AP-SOUTHEAST-2]
Notes:
Hello,

You are receiving this notification because we have identified that you have one or more Amazon RDS for MySQL, MariaDB, and PostgreSQL database instances running on M4, R4, and T2 instance types. You can disregard this notification if you are no longer running these database instances or have already upgraded them to new generation instance types.

In June 2023, Amazon RDS announced the deprecation of M4, R4, and T2 database instance types on Amazon RDS for MySQL, MariaDB, and PostgreSQL.

Starting March 11, 2024, Amazon RDS will begin disabling the creation of Amazon RDS for MySQL, MariaDB, and PostgreSQL database instances running on M4, R4, or T2 instance types. And starting on June 1, 2024, Amazon RDS will make best effort to begin upgrading MySQL, MariaDB, and PostgreSQL database instances running on M4, R4, or T2 instance types to equivalent size M5, R5, or T3 newer generation instance type, if available.

We strongly recommend that you migrate your existing Amazon RDS database instances running M4, R4, and T2 instance types to newer generation instance types before May 31, 2024. You may use the following recommendation:

* Upgrade M4 instance to M5 instance or higher
* Upgrade R4 instance to R5 instance or higher
* Upgrade T2 instance to T3 instance or higher

A list of your impacted resource(s) can be found in the 'Affected resources' tab of your AWS Health Dashboard.

How will my Amazon RDS Reserved Instances (RIs) be impacted?

If you upgrade your instance types that are receiving a billing benefit from RIs, the RIs will no longer cover the database instances and you may see additional on-demand charges on your bill. To avoid this, we recommend the following:

* If you have no RIs, or if your RIs have expired, you should migrate your instances at the earliest convenience.
* If you have active RIs which expire before June 1, 2024, you should wait for the RIs to expire and then migrate your instances. You can then purchase new RIs for the upgraded instance types.
* If you have RIs which will be active after May 31, 2024, you should not migrate your instances. RDS will automatically upgrade database instances and RIs that are active after May 31, 2024.

To seamlessly upgrade your database’s instance type or engine version, you may consider using RDS Blue Green Deployments [1] for RDS MySQL and RDS PostgreSQL. If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to AWS Support [2].

[1] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/blue-green-deployments.html
[2] https://aws.amazon.com/support

Sincerely,
Amazon Web Services

Name: DEV - SXSW Lup as source of truth for UserID + SessionID Favouriting
Notes:
Implement sessionID and favoriting.

Chris wrote the documentation at https://app.swaggerhub.com/apis/LupEvents/FavoritesManagementAPI/1.0.0#/ and implemented the mock for favoriting in the https://github.com/Lup-Events/Lup.VisitorExperienceService. Now we need to implement it.

    Implement a service to support the v1 endpoints and replace the mock data.  
        Always Get user id from the user's token
        Get: Retrieve the list of all favorites for the user at the event. 
        Upsert: You will receive many favorites in one request. Create one documentation per item in the array and use something like to get the IDs for the upsert.
            Instead of using a single getID call, it is recommended to use the get all and then grab the ID if it exists from the set.
            It probably makes a lot of sense to add a bulk upsert to the repository that takes a list of T, and then for each call, store on each, and then only call savechanges once.
    Make sure to use the favorite entity supplied at https://github.com/Lup-Events/Lup.VisitorExperienceService/blob/main/src/Lup.VisitorExperienceService.Web/Domain/Favorite.cs.
    Must have tests.
    Once deployed, perform a performance test, for example, how long does it take to upsert a request with 1, 10, and 100 favs in it.
Blocked By (Dependencies): DEV -  SXSW DOCUMENTATION Provide Session Favouriting API

Name: Favourites API - totals per session summary
Notes:
For favourites API can we also include a count of favourites for All sessions.

this from Scott:

Hey https://lupevents.slack.com/team/U086V88UV, for this capacity indicator feature that the SXSW team has asked us for we were wondering if it would be possible for Lup to provide an api route that would return a favourite count for all sessions.  I believe they are going to have ~2,500 - 3000 sessions so it could be paginated if necessary.  If that is possible we were thinking about hitting that endpoint every 10 minutes or so and caching the results on our end.  This way we could flag sessions as "popular" or "hot" if they have a number of favourites that are near or exceed the capacity indicated on the venue.
from the favourites api document you had sent us previously the response of the users favourites looks like
{ "favorites": [ { "entityId": "guId", "isFavorite": true } ] }

Would it be possible to get a route that could return all favourites? with a response something like this?
{ 
  "favorites": [ 
  { "entityId": "session1", "count": 10},
  { "entityId": "session2", "count": 33},
  { "entityId": "session3", "count": 2},
  { "entityId": "session4", "count": 0},
  { "entityId": "session5", "count": 100},
  ...etc
  ]
}

Notes:
Add new field to Event: IsStockControllerEnable

TRUE or NULL means it's on.  FALSE means it is off.  Default so taht it is NULL or TRUE.  But for current events go through and set it to false if products have no capacity limits

Apply IsStockControllerEnable in ticketing to turn off/on per event basis


----------------------------------------

Find out current Events that has stock-controlled products
SELECT EventID, EventName, DateStart, DateFinish,  SUM(Stock) AS StockedProducts FROM (
SELECT e.EventID, EventName, 
DATEADD(hh, e.EventTimeOffset, e.EventDateStart) DateStart, 
DATEADD(hh, e.EventTimeOffset, e.EventDateFinish) DateFinish,
CASE WHEN TicketProductQtyAvailable > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS Stock
FROM ticketProducts p
INNER JOIN EVENT e ON p.EventID = e.EventID
WHERE p.TicketProductStatus ='active' 
AND e.EventDateFinish > GETUTCDATE()
AND e.EventDateStart > DATEADD(mm, -1, GETUTCDATE())
AND e.EventDateFinish < DATEADD(dd, 5, GETUTCDATE())
)a
GROUP BY EventID, EventName, DateStart, DateFinish

Name: Expobridge Slow Refresh
Notes:
I used this script and tested refreshing a bunch of data and found that 2 of the refresh where very slow or timed out even when i set the limit to 10 records

BEGIN TRAN DECLARE @eventid int = 917 DECLARE @groupSize int = 100 -- For RefreshEvents INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) VALUES( NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GetUTCDate(), 0, 'RefreshEvents', '', '{ids:['+CAST(@eventid AS VARCHAR(5))+']}') -- For RefreshSurveys INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshSurveys', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(SurveyID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT SurveyID, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY SurveyID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM Survey WHERE eventid = @eventid ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber -- For RefreshQuestionDetails INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshQuestionDetails', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(QuestionDetailsID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT QuestionDetailsID, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY QuestionDetailsID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM Survey JOIN QuestionDetails ON QuestionDetails.SurveyID = Survey.SurveyID WHERE eventid = @eventid ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber -- For RefreshQuestionOptions INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshQuestionOptions', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(OptionID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT OptionID, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY OptionID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM Survey JOIN QuestionDetails ON QuestionDetails.SurveyID = Survey.SurveyID JOIN QuestionOptions ON QuestionDetails.QuestionDetailsID = QuestionOptions.QuestionDetailsID WHERE eventid = @eventid ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber -- For RefreshClients INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshClients', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(ClientID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT ClientID, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY ClientID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM Survey WHERE eventid = @eventid AND ClientID IS NOT NULL ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber -- For RefreshTickets INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshTickets', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(Ticketid AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT Ticketid, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY Ticketid) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM tickets WHERE eventid = @eventid ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber -- For RefreshVisitors INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshVisitors', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(VisitorID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT VisitorID, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY VisitorID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM tickets WHERE EventID = @eventid AND VisitorID IS NOT NULL ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber -- For RefreshAnswers INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshAnswers', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(AnswerID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT Answer.AnswerID, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY Answer.AnswerID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM Answer JOIN Survey ON Answer.SurveyID = Survey.SurveyID WHERE EventID = @eventid ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber -- For RefreshAnswerDetails INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshAnswerDetails', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(AnswerDetailsID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT AnswerDetailsID, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY AnswerDetailsID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM Answer JOIN AnswerDetails ON Answer.AnswerID = AnswerDetails.AnswerID JOIN Survey ON Answer.SurveyID = Survey.SurveyID WHERE eventid = @eventid ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber -- For RefreshTicketOrders INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshTicketOrders', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(TicketOrderID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT TicketOrderID, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TicketOrderID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM TicketOrders WHERE eventid = @eventid ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber -- For RefreshTicketProducts INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshTicketProducts', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(TicketProductID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT TicketProductID, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TicketProductID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM TicketProducts WHERE eventid = @eventid ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber -- For RefreshTicketOrderProducts INSERT ExpoBridge (Id, [Status], CreatedUtcDate, ProcessAtUtcDate, RetryCount, ClrTypeName, LastFailureMessage, [Json]) SELECT NEWID(), 0, GETUTCDATE(), GETUTCDATE(), 0, 'RefreshTicketOrderProducts', '', '{ids:[' + STRING_AGG(CAST(TicketOrderProductID AS VARCHAR(MAX)), ',') + ']}' FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT TicketOrderProductID, CEILING(ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TicketOrderProductID) / CAST(@groupSize AS float)) AS GroupNumber FROM TicketOrderProducts JOIN TicketOrders ON TicketOrderProducts.TicketOrderID = TicketOrders.TicketOrderID WHERE eventid = @eventid ) r GROUP BY GroupNumber SELECT * FROM ExpoBridge where [Status] = 0 ROLLBACK

Name: Lup.ExpoBridge.ExpoMessagePump.Web
Notes:
We need to be able to scale out the number of instances of the message pump and not have it muck around with the triggers

AllowedMessages
['ExpoAnswerDetailAdded', 'ExpoTicketUpdated', 'ExpoTicketOrderUpdated', 'ExpoTicketOrderProductAdded', 'ExpoTicketAdded', 'ExpoTicketOrderProductUpdated', 'ExpoTicketOrderAdded', 'ExpoTicketOrderTransactionAdded', 'ExpoAnswerAdded', 'ExpoAnswerUpdated', 'ExpoVisitorUpdated', 'ExpoTicketOrderTransactionUpdated', 'ExpoVisitorAdded', 'ExpoTicketProductUpdated']

The main instance should handle the refresh events and the other pumps should handle the added and updated.

Name: Fixes to permissions for attendance reporting
Notes:
guard on attendance is failing (they should see the data just not the links, they are currently not seeing anything
Check if i give someone csv link that if they aren't registrationdataexport permission that they cant download that csv.


    Attendance TRUE + RegistrationDateExport=FALSE :
    Show report list
    Show buttons on report list
    Show report details
    Don't show CSV button
    Don't allow to access CSV even with a direct link
    Attendance FALSE + RegistrationDateExport=FALSE:
    DON'T Show report list
    DON'T Show buttons on report list
    DON'T Show report details
    Don't show CSV button
    Don't allow to access CSV even with a direct link

    Attendance TRUE + RegistrationDateExport=TRUE:
    Show report list
    Show buttons on report list
    Show report details
    YES show CSV button
    YES allow to access CSV even with a direct link

    Attendance FALSE + RegistrationDateExport=TRUE:
    DON'T Show report list
    DON'T Show buttons on report list
    DON'T Show report details
    Don't show CSV button
    Don't allow to access CSV even with a direct link

select 'https://admin.lup.com.au/Order/Index/' + cast(eventorders.eventorderID as nvarchar) as Link, eventorders.EventOrderID,  eventorders.OrderContactCompany, eventorders.OrderContactFirstName,
       OrderContactPhone, OrderContactEmail,
       UserID,  email, users.Mobile,  UserStatus, sum(survey.HardwareCount) as HardwareOrdered, sum(survey.AppUserCount) as AppLicenses, '' as ConsolePasswordSet
from eventorders
left outer  join users on  eventorders.userid = users.id
left outer join survey on eventorders.EventOrderID = survey.EventOrderID and survey.surveystatus='Active'

Name: DEV -  SXSW DOCUMENTATION Provide Session Favouriting API
Notes:
EventBase and https://SXSWSydney.com want Lup to be the source of truth for SessionID + UserID pairing.

API's require
    UserID + SessionID + State = Endpoint
        Is it just one sessionID at a time or multiple
    When an app user favourites a specific session
    When an app user unfavourites a specific session
    
    Favourite a session - ie Create
    Unfavourite a session - ie Update
    List all sessions favourited for a given user (for an event) - List
    Check if a specific sessionID is favourited or not for that UserID - Read

Name: Importer - Add Verification
Notes:
As an event organiser
When I have data imported
I want the option of it to honour the verification/security approval requirements of that product.

eg in certain events we have certain products set to require verification. When we import, after selecting a pack/product it should automatically set a (changeable) option to be "Ticket Status" with options of "Active - approved" or "Verification - approval required".

    Once they choose a pack. itshould update status to be whatever the verification status of the Product is set in TicketOrderProducts table.
    Allow the user to change the setting if they want.

Name: Doubling up of user accounts in console issue
Notes:
Sometimes a user has two logins in console and then can't get in

Discuss

As per slack
https://lupevents.slack.com/archives/C0MT9NY3Z/p1713054955650299

We have two competing user stores that commit user changes in bulk. 
→ The raw ApplicationDbContext;
→ The usermanager which is two layers above the raw db context:
   hierarchy is: dbcontext, userstore, usermanager when saving users. 

We are running into race conditions where one store might think a user is created but the other user store doesn't or even the opposite (a user exists but a user store says it doesn't), attempted "failsafes" to ensure users are saved has lead to duplicate users being created.

Ultimate fix is to rip out any mention of the raw dbcontext.users and use the context that the usermanager exposes. We will then trigger a user migration so all data is synced and managed using the same db context
Blocking (Dependencies): Upgrade admin prod to use new identity service login

Notes:

As Lup Sales team
When I process an order and create a survey, I want it to auto-detect and update the survey.App and SurveyDeviceMode to the correct one
So that it saves time and mistakes when processing orders

    Create Scan
    Include a new field for "Is LeadScanner App Enabled" (user editable)
    Include a new field for Survey.HardwareCount and Survey.AppUserCount (user editable)

Name: Importer Release Notes
Importer v1 - Summary
Notes:
Background

Customer data is invaluable and helps provide insights and actionable outcomes for  any Event Organiser.   It feeds into the marketing, cross-promotions and execution of future events.  It is critical to Know Your Customer.   The source of customer data can come directly from prospective visitors (as attendees), from an Organizer's ERP systems or from exhibitors.  
The specific context of an event can alter the manner in which customer data is obtained and how it is used, the constant here is that there is a need for a quick  and self-service function to upload data from an Organiser into the Lüp platform.  

Problem Statement

A common request from customers (Event Organiser) is for the team to upload Visitor and/or Exhibitor Data into Lüp, which has been exported from their own systems.  This process is required when badges or tickets are issued outside of the Lüp Platform and need to be imported in.  Lüp have previously provided an Import function, however this ceased to function in 2022 and has not yet been restored.  Currently, this process requires an Engineer to action the request.  This process is often last minute/ time sensitive due to the nature of Events.  The customer's expectation is that imports can be turned around in 30 minutes to within one hour (amda).  An Organiser will ask for this multiple times (GEFE 2022 recently involved 8 separate imports, Avalon was 50+.)  On average each request takes 30 minutes (provided the data quality is good).
An import process is impacted by Bad Data - poorly formatted Excel Files, unexpected special characters, renamed column headings, file type/size.     
In summary, the process is unsustainable and should transition to a self-service feature managed by non-technical Lüp team members and eventually, the potential for an Organiser to manage the process themselves (self-service). 


Design

Pre-requisites and Requirements
    Data is at an Event level > Organisers Portal
    Event must have been created in Lüp Admin
    Fixed set of fields/ headings/ aliases to chose from (reflective of database tables)
    Data validation/ cleanse (simple)
    Minimum level of mandatory data, plus access to extended info
    Batch history tracking
    Error handling.  If issue, fail ALL or provide Exception Report (ER preferred). 
    Ability to send confirmation email or opt out. 

Customer Process 1
Customer is given the Lüp template to populate.
Customer completes template, returns to Lüp.
Lüp Admin does sanity check on file, copies to fresh template and uploads.

Customer Process 2 (paid service)
Customer provide Lüp Admin a raw file of the data they need to upload.
Lüp Admin formats the data, reports any obvious issues back to Organisation.
Corrections may occur to a working file.  
Lüp Amin copies to a fresh template and updates.
 
What is customer data?
    Title / First Name/ Last Name
    Company /  Position
    Email / Mobile number
    Location (Postcode/ City)

What Else is needed?
    A unique identifier record
    A batch reference
    Ticket Product Name/IDs
    Ticket Pack Name/ID
    Ticket Barcode/ Shortcode/Longcode
    Badgeline free text 1/2/3/4
    A way to  manage duplicates - update record Vs add records? 

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1204597521750464



Use Cases

    An organiser needs to get Event, Visitor and/or Exhibitor data into Lüp immediately.
    An organiser may need to bulk update existing information about an Event, Visitor and/or Exhibitor. 
    An organiser may have chosen to switch from another event / ticketing platform to Lüp.
    An organiser may need to  pre-allocate badges or tickets before receiving attendee information.

User Story
AS a Lüp Admin, 
I NEED the ability to upload Visitor/Exhibitor data as a CSV file in the importer template structure, 
With simple data cleansing,
With error handling and exception reporting,
With Batch identification,
SO THAT I do not have to enter Visitor/Exhibitor data manually,
SO THAT the Organiser can be prepared for people to come onsite.

 AS AN organizer,
I NEED the ability to issue tickets originating outside of Lüp 
I NEED the ability to issue and pre-print badges for 
AND I NEED a way to have the data bulk imported into the Lüp Platform, 
SO THAT I can manage my event effectively via Lüp.      

Acceptance Criteria
    A Lüp Administrator can access a clean template for population
    A Lüp Administrator can import/export the following (and potentially more) customer/registration data fields:
        Title / First Name/ Last Name
        Company /  Position
        Email / Mobile number
        Location (Postcode/ City)
        A unique identifier record
        A batch reference
        Ticket Product Name/IDs
        Ticket Pack Name/ID
        Ticket Barcode/ Shortcode/Longcode
        Badgeline free text 1/2/3/4
        Questionnaire responses 
    A way to  manage update record Vs add records?  Avoid duplicates
    Upload Batch tracking - ability to know what was uploaded and when. 
    Note:  Questionnaires will always be custom. 

Solution 

Release 1:
Internal Lüp Admin tool 
    Restore Original Importer functionality (parity)
    Add new Record only
    Select pack/product in dropdown
    Error Handling - failure if invalid information. 


Release 2:
Internal Admin tool continued
    Update Records
    Exception Handling and Exception Report
Extend to Externally facing tool? 

Consider: Simple Vs Beginner functionality. 

Design

Pre-requisites and Requirements
    Data is at an Event level > Organisers Portal
    Event must have been created in Lüp Admin
    Fixed set of fields/ headings/ aliases to chose from (reflective of database tables)
    Data validation/ cleanse (simple)
    Minimum level of mandatory data, plus access to extended info
    Batch history tracking
    Error handling.  If issue, fail ALL or provide Exception Report (ER preferred). 

Customer Process 1
Customer is given the Lüp template to populate.
Customer completes template, returns to Lüp.
Lüp Admin does sanity check on file, copies to fresh template and uploads.

Customer Process 2 (paid service)
Customer provide Lüp Admin a raw file of the data they need to upload.
Lüp Admin formats the data, reports any obvious issues back to Organisation.
Corrections may occur to a working file.  
Lüp Amin copies to a fresh template and updates.
 

What is customer data?  Standard Fields in Visitor Table:
    Title / First Name/ Last Name
    Company /  Position
    Email / Mobile number
    Location (Postcode/ City)
    Badgeline free text 1/2/3/4
    

What Else is needed?  Changing values or customisable. 
    A unique identifier record
    A batch reference
    Ticket Product Name/IDs
    Ticket Pack Name/ID
    Ticket Barcode/ Shortcode/Longcode
    Questionnaire information ** 
    A way to  manage duplicates - update record Vs add records? 

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1DZ3ltyz45pSj2ndPtcYTl50A5o5bvlLHaJAFkuxjRKQ/edit?usp=sharing

**very custom 

Use Cases

    An organiser needs to get Event, Visitor and/or Exhibitor data into Lüp immediately.
    An organiser may need to bulk update existing information about an Event, Visitor and/or Exhibitor. 
    An organiser may have chosen to switch from another event / ticketing platform to Lüp.
    An organiser may need to  pre-allocate badges or tickets before receiving attendee information.

User Story
AS a Lüp Admin, 
I NEED the ability to upload Visitor/Exhibitor data as a CSV file in the importer template structure, 
With simple data cleansing,
With error handling and exception reporting,
With Batch identification,
SO THAT I do not have to enter Visitor/Exhibitor data manually,
SO THAT the Organiser can be prepared for 

 AS AN organizer,
I NEED the ability to issue tickets originating outside of Lüp 
I NEED the ability to issue and pre-print badges for 
AND I NEED a way to have the data bulk imported into the Lüp Platform, 
SO THAT I can manage my event effectively via Lüp.      

Acceptance Criteria
    A Lüp Administrator can access a clean template for population
    A Lüp Administrator can import/export the following (and potentially more) customer/registration data fields:
        Title / First Name/ Last Name
        Company /  Position
        Email / Mobile number
        Location (Postcode/ City)
        A unique identifier record
        A batch reference
        Ticket Product Name/IDs
        Ticket Pack Name/ID
        Ticket Barcode/ Shortcode/Longcode
        Badgeline free text 1/2/3/4
        Questionnaire responses 
    A way to quickly import known basic information - and store custom information for later use (JSON blob?)
    A way to  manage update record Vs add records?  Avoid duplicates
    Upload Batch tracking - ability to know what was uploaded and when. 

Solution 

Release 1:
Internal Lüp Admin tool 
    Introduce a feature with minimum of parity to original Importer 
    Add new Record only
    Import basic Visitor Table info - store rest for future custom management
    Error Handling - failure if invalid information. 

Release 2:
Internal Admin tool continued
    Handle custom values (outside of standard visitor table info - questionaire answers)
    Update Records
    Exception Handling and Exception Report

In Scope 
    A User-Interface for template download/ upload for complete file.  Preferably in new Architecture.

Name: [TOCHECK][Action required] Update Your Amazon RDS and Amazon Aurora SSL/TLS Certificates by August 22, 2024 [AWS Account: 766365401972] [AP-SOUTHEAST-2]
Notes:
Hello,

[AWS Health may periodically trigger reminder notifications about this communication.]

You are receiving this message because your AWS Account has one or more Amazon RDS, or Amazon Aurora database instances in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region using a SSL/TLS Certificate that is expiring on August 22, 2024. 

A list of your affected resources can be found in the 'Affected resources' tab of your AWS Health Dashboard.

This is a follow-up notification for SSL/TLS CA certification expiration. If you believe you have already finished this work and still received this email, it is likely because you created new instances using the 2019 Certificate Authority (CA). After January 25, 2024 all newly created instances that do not explicitly specify a different CA will use the ‘rds-ca-rsa2048-g1’ CA. For information on setting an account level CA override, see the modify-certificates API documentation [1].

If your applications connect to these instances using the SSL/TLS protocol, you will need to take action before August 22, 2024 to prevent connectivity failures to your existing database instances. Even if you do not currently use SSL for your connections, you could still be affected if your databases server certificate expires, so we still recommend updating your CA.

To protect your communications with your database instances, a CA generates time-bound certificates that are checked by your database client software to authenticate any database instance before exchanging information. Following industry best practices, AWS renews the CA and creates new certificates on a routine basis to ensure customer connections are properly protected for years to come. The current CA in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region will expire on August 22, 2024. Before this date you will need to update your DB server certificate. The following is the general process to do this:

First, update your application clients with the new certificate, if your application client is using a trust store then add the new CA certificates into the trust stores of your client applications. RDS provides download links to the CA certificates in our User Guide [2]. For more detailed instructions on updating the trust stores on your client application see our documentation [3].

Second, update the certificate on all your affected database instances to one of the newly issued CAs. ‘rds-ca-rsa2048-g1’ is the default recommended CA because there is no algorithm change. The other CAs use new key algorithms so it could require more testing of your client setup to ensure compatibility. For more information on the new CAs see our documentation [4].

Third, if you want to use a different CA than the default ‘rds-ca-rsa2048-g1’, you will need to set an account level CA override so your new instances will use the CA of your choice. To do this a modify-certificates API is available that will allow you to override the default CA on newly created database instances to either the old or one of the new CAs. This override will only apply while the CA you are overriding to is valid. To use this API you will need to be running the AWS CLI version 1.17 or later. For more information see the modify-certificates API documentation [1]. There is also a describe-certificates API [5], that will indicate your current default CA override if you have one set. To set a specific CA during instance creation use the ca-certificate-identifier option on the create-db-instance API to create a DB instance with a specific CA. For more information, see the create-db-instance API documentation [6].

For more detailed instructions on how to perform these updates, please see the Amazon RDS instances [7] and Amazon Aurora instances [8] documentation.

Please be aware of the following timeline:

1. As soon as possible - You should update your client trust store, then you can update your instances server certificate to one generated by one of the new CAs.

2. After January 26, 2024 - any new database instances default to using the ‘rds-ca-rsa2048-g1’ certificate. If you wish for new instances to use a different certificate, you can specify which certificate to use with the AWS console or the AWS CLI. For more information, see the create-db-instance API documentation [6].

3. After August 22, 2024 - ‘rds-ca-2019’ will expire. You will need to take action before August 22, 2024, to prevent connectivity failures to your existing database instances.

For more information see our blog [9], and if you have questions or concerns, please contact AWS Support [10].

[1] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/rds/modify-certificates.html
[2] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/UsingWithRDS.SSL.html#UsingWithRDS.SSL.CertificatesAllRegions
[3] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/UsingWithRDS.SSL-certificate-rotation.html#UsingWithRDS.SSL-certificate-rotation-updating
[4] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/UsingWithRDS.SSL.html#UsingWithRDS.SSL.RegionCertificateAuthorities
[5] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/rds/describe-certificates.html
[6] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/rds/create-db-instance.html
[7] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/UsingWithRDS.SSL-certificate-rotation.html
[8] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/UsingWithRDS.SSL-certificate-rotation.html
[9] https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/rotate-your-ssl-tls-certificates-now-amazon-rds-and-amazon-aurora-expire-in-2024/
[10] https://console.aws.amazon.com/support/home

Sincerely,
Amazon Web Services

Name: Update to sales report (GST)
Tags: Dev Team Request,ACCEPTED (Dev Team Request),Platform Maintenance
Notes:
Hey team,

This event is meant to charge $0 for GST. However we didn't override admin and so the tax amount of each pack was left with a $ value.

We have since updated each of the packs to have a $0 tax value, however we do need the report to reflect this also. 

Could you please update the sales report in admin and console so that all tax is $0? 

At this point in time there are 10 paid transactions; so perhaps updating the transactions is the better process here. 

Here is the sales report before we updated the Pack tax amount for reference:

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1206915684774387



My expectation is that the Total remains at $745, however the Ex Tax and Inc Tax be equal.

If you could also run a report to confirm that each pack does have a $0 tax value that would be great; I am worried that 1 pack might have been missed and therefore will cause issues again. This will just help double check the work.

Thanks!

As per Paul below are some of the issues of the Lup>Grip integration we I’ve flagged with Grip that need to be rectified. This may also require Lup developer input.
        Exhibitor Rep registration – the automatic connecting Exh Reps to their company didn’t happen for like 70% of the time. I had to manually add people.
        Lup data Sync - Stop data sync from Lup after first import so that Grip becomes the master of the data. There next event is in Sydney 14th September
Please let me know if you require any info to investigate the above.

Name: Design Page - Developer Tools
Seq Alerts
API Services Permissions
Notes:
Qualified and Unqualified Permissions

(Open to a name change here)

A Person is a member of an Org and have permissions in that org.
i.e. Manage Users
See Attendance Reports
See Surveys
See financial reports

We can add permissions that are qualified (i.e. specific to an event) or Unqualified (i.e. they have that permission no matter what).
Each person can have a number of permissions, to do an action we can look through their permissions and find a reason to allow them.

Some examples:

Alice works for company 123, who run events

Permisson
EventID
Manage


Attendance Reports


Financial Reports




Alice can do anything for any of the companies events, her permissions are “Unqualified”.

Bob also works for company 123 but is in marketing, and can see attendance reports.
Except on smaller shows where he’s also in charge of the budget.
This company also is an exhibitor at a trade show and Bob is allowed to see survey data.
Bobs primary permissions are “Unqualified”, but he has some permissions where he has a qualification for specific events.


Permission
EventID
Attendance Reports


Financial Reports
993939, 27282
See Surveys




When we edit users, we can use the API from event service to populate the UI, but we only need to store event IDs in identity. That is to say, identity does not need any details about events.

User Claims
When a user logs in, Identity will give them a token with claims.


Claim
Value

alice@company.com

    Discussion - Should we have a “Manage” permission that encompasses all the others?


Viewing Surveys

This should be simple.
A survey is attached to an event, and attached to an exhibitors Org.

So a user with a See Surveys permission, should be able to see events where the event ID is in one of their active surveys.

Downloading CSVs
This could just be a property on the attachment of a survey to an event.
