Name: Lup Lead Scanning - Planning
Notes:
https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVMkNFRPs=/?share_link_id=369019777735

Use Cases for Console & App (React native App).

Brief:

Build a replacement for the Lead Scanner App* (PWA, not an App).
Build an actual App - React Native
That is aligned to Console in terms of Architecture and Design.
That is a product that will be used by Exhibitors in the beginning.
A possible proof of concept for rebuilding of the Lup App (actual) that is used as a conduit for ticket scanning.
Logging, Diagnostics and Error info is expected to be included - Pinging server = usage statistics.
Authentication through Identity Service is a must. 


In Console
Lup Admin needs:
    Ability to issue 'license'/ permissions to a nominated Exhibitor User (as main Exhib contact - SuperExhibitor/ Exhibitor Superuser vs Simple Users)
    Simple Users would not need the ability to access Console.,


Exhib Admin needs:
    Ability to issue additional users for their Exhibitor Staff for onsite use - users to be authorised by Lup Identity Service.
    Ability to set up their Questions/ Context for the Lead Scanner App  - Stands etc
    Ability to download data (supported through Exhib scans) - with the inclusion of which device & person did the scanning.
    Main Exhibitor contact needs SuperExhibitor Access - including settings and management for themselves and simple users. 


In App
    Authentication via Identity Service for all users
        Users represented by Identify Service email and Nominated name.
    Clear Error Messaging when an issue occurs
    Note taking feature against a Lead
    Q - At what point is a lead Uploaded? How long can an App user revisit the entry for notes?
    Clear indicators of when data is uploaded/sync'd to Lup.
        Does this need to be instigated by a user?
    DO NOT ASSUME THAT INTERNET IS GOING TO BE WORKING> A stable offline mode for when Internet connectivity is low.
        Activate on first time - needs internet - any other time
    If it scans, it get Uploaded - even if unregistered, even if invalid - the server should still receive the data - something.
        do not discard
        Exhibitors like to come back later and add more details later. Need ability the go back on data and update.
    When you scan, you should see all the person's details in the app - want the ability to update. Should it update across lup as a whole if data is updated? NO. 
        IF unregistered scans - give ability to enter contact detail info - MAIN record or in User record only?
    Permissions - if I log onto the app on another phone - it is desirable that I can see everything that I scanned. I should only see my scans, as an Exhibitor support (Vs Admin)
        Which person
        Which Event
    Self cleaning, upload on device.  Keep data on device for as long as you are logged in.
        Load profile and clear someone else's scans. 
        SYNC Before clear out. 
    Question types that need to be supported - free text, notes, radio button and checkbox.  Do not need immediately: date pickers, photo uploads yet. (check samples from database on types of questions and method).


CHALLENGES:
IOS - App store and version - may not work on all of our devices.  NEED TO DEFINE MINIMUM SPEC.
One Device may need to work across multiple Events and/or Multiple Exhibitor Stands/Brands.
    THIS NEEDS TO BE FLESHED OUT https://app.asana.com/0/1203444542847929/list.
Multiple Events, Surveys in Same Event. Co-located.



Neesh's Phased Scope - Tony And Jess feel MVP should be one release with all three functions. 
Two types- Scanning and Scanning with Questions
    MVP: Simple Scanning (Not consumer facing) - no questions.
    Next: Add Notes
    Next Next: Add extra questions.



Scan - surface qualifying questions.


Billing Implications on set-up
    Will we charge organiser or user for each person you add
        Seats or transaction based? Seats/licensing is archaic.

Name: Global Report Filters
Notes:
Currently user have the ability to Filter Products for the Year on Year Report here:

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1205704844927583



We want to introduce a GLOBAL Filter to impact all Reports and Figures in Console.  Global Select Product Requirements to include: Year on Year, Sales Summary, Sale graphs, Widget for Sales/Tickets,  Widget for Attendance (future).

Name: Reports Tuning
Notes:
Queries are timing out sending data sets from sql server in Azure to Reporting in AWS.

Theres likely multiple issues at play some queries are suboptimal whilst others are returning massive dataset, depending on the root cause per query we can choose how to tune it:
    Some queries can be tuned for performance gains by optimising the query itself.
    Some will need to have their results sent back in batches as the resultant dataset can be too large.

Either of these options will need specific and deliberate changes per report.

As a followup to either 1 or 2 we can change the client side to refresh/cache data for a longer period of time thus reducing the network traffic.

Name: Release Notes Update: Geomap & YoY
Notes:
Please update release notes in Console. 

Updates should automatically move to the top of the page.

    YOY

Header: Year on Year Sales Graph
Brief: Lüp have introduced a  report which allows Organisers to compare ticketing sales across multiple years or specific Events. 

Read more:
Lüp have introduced a  report which allows Organisers to compare ticketing sales across multiple years or specific Events. 
The Year on Year Sales Report includes a table and a graph to represent a series of Events that are being compared.  In the table each Event has information that confirms
    Event Name
    Ticket quantity sold
    Revenue $
    Qty of Paid Transaction
    Qty of Unpaid Transactions
    
The graph represents the Qty of Ticket Sales (Y Axis) and the historical ‘days out’ from the event (X Axis).  The graph has the function to select specific Products for filtering.  Each event is represented by a uniquely coloured line that charts the ticket sales (qty) per day. 



https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1205588778504515




2.  GEOMAP

Header: Geomap Report
Brief: Lüp have introduced a  report which allows Organisers to see their Ticket Sales visualised as a 'heat-map' on a map of Australia. 

Read more:
Lüp have introduced a  report which allows Organisers to see their Ticket Sales visualised as a 'heat-map'. 
The map is created by utilising an API service provided by Mapbox that returns the geodata for location (latitude and longitude) and the Postcode from the Ticket Order Details captured at the time of purchase.  This is then rendered within a dynamic map of Australia.

They key inputs for the map are Postcode and Quantity of Tickets sold per Postcode.

Users can zoom in and out on areas within the map to see more granular sales information.   

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1205588778504519


Ticket sales quantity are represented in a 'heatmap' style.  

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1205588778504521


The higher the number of tickets purchased within a local area/ postcode the darker the indicator will be. 



https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1205588778504523


If you hover over the Ticket sold locations, you can see the quantity. 

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1205588778504525


The Geomap also pins the physical Event location of the event with a starred Icon.

Name: Universal Report technical design
Notes:
Build a “universal report” as per the spreadsheet example. 

We should capture orders, tickets, and registrations by subscribing to Expo activity and build a denormalised (flattened) record for each row in the spreadsheet example.


https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1205265916524191



When a user requests a report, we should build the data into an Excel spreadsheet for them to download.

Because some of the reports are going to be quite large, we should introduce an async process to build the report in the background and send the user an email with an expiring download link.

When the user clicks a link we should validate it by checking the token (GUID) plus the email address in the link, then serve the XLS file and audit the download.

So we can avoid large storage fees we should also have a scheduled task to clean up old report data.


https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1205265916524185



https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1205265916524187

YoY Sales Graph Countdown - time discrepancy - AEDT Vs AEST?
Notes:
From Customer https://admin.lup.com.au/Event/EventDetail/2204 
Q: Can please check the below reporting from https://admin.lup.com.au/Organiser/Report/Ticketing/b69c83a3-cc75-4838-bac8-225ded04ad1f vs. https://console.lup.events/events/b69c83a3-cc75-4838-bac8-225ded04ad1f/sales/salesyearonyear, there is 1 ticket discrepancy. if you check the time in the Console is 3 hours and 1 minute ahead vs. to admin.  Please advise why there is a discrepancy?

Attempts to recreate: 

I just checked now and it is indicating an hour and less than one minute difference, which I suspect could be Daylight Savings related.  Daylight Savings commenced in Australia on 1/10/2023 - Event is in Melbourne, which uses AEDT as opposed to AEST now.   

I also pointed out (in the dev-assist thread) that The date/time also does not count down dynamically on either page, it needs to be refreshed.

Could there also be a time difference caused by the frequency in which the report data is being pulled through to each platform? Ie - it hits Admin slightly before Console?

I was just able to get the different down to 1 hour flat upon refreshing:

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1205646989784292


I just checked a NZ Event:  Seems Admin respects LOCAL time,whereas Console may be on AEST?

Name: Importer: Badge line logic iteration
Notes:
With the current version of importer, elmerfudd has been disabled, so badgeline1/2/3 are populated by the text/ data in the import file.  

This can cause issues for some use cases 

    When a product changes  - we need to update the products badge text, how can that be changed?
    We may have more complicated badgelinerules that are based off multiple steps, not just a simple product → badgeline relationship
    If we upgrade/change a pack/product then the badgelines should change to the new product. This isn't happening
    If we change a product's default badgeline and requeue, then the expectation of users is that this should update all tickets, including imported


Proposed solution:
    Remove badgelines from importer template and importer functionality - leave everyone to the mercy of elmerfudd.

Name: Refactor importer code to include unregistered tickets in mail sending
Notes:
When an import is done through Console and there are MULTIPLE tickets registered to one single user -  and the Email option is selected, MQUEUE is currently only sending the first Ticket to the  provided email address.
The behaviour should be that all unregistered tickets are send to the nominated email address.

Neesh has also investigated and determined:
Currently the importer adds to MQUEUE https://admin.lup.com.au/MQueue/Detail/10812318
New ticketOrder emails should are sent out via MQUEUEhttps://admin.lup.com.au/MQueue/Detail/10812384
So it probably just needs a tweak on how it is added to MQUEUE and which fields are used.

Notes:
Sales package report https://console.staging.lup.events/events/5884df89-86c4-4e67-97ea-a41e74d32e1d/sales/salespackage

It shows Qty, which is qty of the packs sold. But if a pack has 2 or 4 tickets in (eg 2 for 1 or family bundle) then it's not telling us how many tickets were sold.

One option would be to include a column for "Tickets" or "Tix" that shows how many tickets were sold in these packs.  (be sure to count the tickets that are in the actual orders of those packs. Don't count the ticketpackproducts relationship as that may change before or after orders have been processed)

eg Package Name / Qty / Tix / ex Tax / Inc Tax

We will have separate Release note entries for Console/Identity launch , Reporting and Importer.

Name: Console/Identity Release Notes
Notes:
Release Notes


Welcome to Lüp Console.

As part of the Console launch, we have conducted  a migration to a new authentication system, Identity.Lup.  To simplify the experience, all users are required to change their Lüp Admin password when prompted.  (As you are currently logged in to Console and reading this, you have already taken the necessary steps to reset your password.)

Why did we make changes to authentication and build Console?

Previously Lüp has maintained multiple platforms, with unique authentication methods.  This is an endeavour to simplify the experience for all users. Users will now log in to Lüp Admin and Lüp Console with the same credentials. We are now able to offer two factor authentication as an added security feature.

 Watch this space for new features!

Name: Reporting Release Notes
Notes:
Release Notes

Welcome to Reporting in  Lüp Console.

Lüp Console Reporting is a new reporting platform, built on AWS microservices and introduced to replace Cloud, Stats and Yellow Reporting.  Reporting in Lüp Admin will remain live with the same functionality.

Why did we make changes to Reporting and build Console?

Previously Lüp has maintained multiple reporting platforms, with unique authentication methods.  This is unsustainable, so we set out to simplify the experience for all users and limit the number of platforms and authentication methods.  Users will now log in to Lüp Admin and Lüp Console with the same credentials in order to access Reporting.

The new platform architecture will support our ability to iterate and deliver regular enhancements to our reporting product in Console.

What is available in Lüp Console Reporting?

The information you see  will differ per user type.

An Exhibitor will see a list of events that they have surveys for, along with the Exhibitor Scan summary and records.

 An Organiser will see their list of events Sales Summary, Sales Graph, high level Exhibitor Scan Summary:
 Sales Per  Product
 Sales Per Package
 Sales Per Product Per Day

Watch this space for new features!

Name: Change background migration tasks in identity service to use api key
Migration of Survey Data to Event Service
Notes:
An exhibitor is defined as someone who is part of an org that is not directly running an event but has survey data tied to that event. e.g. I am running a stall for Lup inside a Developer Conference ran by Amazon.

An exhibitor will only need/have org roles for their organisation (Lup) and is not necessary or required to be apart of the organiser's organisation (Amazon).
A valid list of events to be shown for a user is derived from what event id their surveys are tied to and not from the event.


https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1204920738340816


We need to use our message pump to fetch a list of surveys with:
    survey id 
    event id
    client id
to accurately map what events an exhibitor should have access to.


https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1204920738340818


tl;dr;

    Use event message pump to subscribe to survey table and ingest:
    surveyid
    eventid
    clientid
and then publish message onto bus.

2. subscribe to new survey message from event service.
3. alter queries on event controller to look for relevant surveys tied to the event that match the users orgs in their token.

At this point we should be able to assume the persona of an exhibitor and lookup relevant events.

Exhibitor Reporting Requirements
Notes:
AS AN EXHIBITOR, I need to

    See and interact with a list of events that I have surveys for

    Be able to download a CSV if I have permissions and the survey has ShowCSV flag turned on

Notes on Exhibitor Reports: 

    CSV reports are enabled/ disabled based on payment.  
    There are two flags in admin that dictate if a CSV will be available:
        Survey.CSV = FALSE / True
        User.CSV = TRUE

    EXHIBITORS: Ability do download the CSV file (same as what's on stats)

Need User Login with Exhibitor Persona/ permissions
Notes:
Create and set up a User Login with Exhibitor Persona/ permissions.

What’s an exhibitor (Reporting)


•A user that belongs to an organisation that is associated with a survey.
•The difference is an organiser is associated with the event and gets access to all surveys for that event.
•Surveys in expo include a 1-1 relationship with an event and a client (org).

Problem 1: Disconnect between orgs and events migrated

Our initial implementation for migrating orgs filters out those that have been “deanonymized”

Meaning some orgs that are tied to an event, don’t exist in our current system (this is a problem for staging)

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1204868724415291

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1204868726023537

https://app.asana.com/app/asana/-/get_asset?asset_id=1204868726023539



Solution to Problem 1

Don’t filter orgs and migrate all of them.



Problem 2: Admin relies on forms based auth which redirects all calls to use old login system

    Background Tasks are run from identity service to migrate users and clients.
        These tasks hit an endpoint in exponewsadmin and require
        The usenewAuth feature flag to be turned on in expo so we can auth requests with client credentials flow as well as a deployment to remove a node in web.config which happened when said feature flag is on.
    Problem is we cannot use background migration without turning on new feature flag.
    Node in web.config needs to exist for old login system, but we need away to hit our new endpoint with our new login system.

Possible Solution to Problem 2: 

    Simple api key that we store in id server and exponews that we attach to request and we don’t use client credentials to auth to migration endpoints.
    https://app.asana.com/0/1204335833086515/board enpoint in expo news is called BackgroundMigrationController.
    if you can as well we call into the client and user repos and filter out "test looking" data but we need that data specifically for clients in expo so can you remove that filter when you're in there?

remove startswith("Name") for clients
